Title: Government orders 42k tonnes of onions, finds takers for 3k tonnes
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

TOI file photo

NEW DELHI: Onion supplies are expected to be remain under pressure during January and February with domestic production in 2020 expected to top the 2019 level only in March, providing relief to consumers complaining of high prices of the kitchen staple.

Estimates available with the Centre suggested that production in January is expected to be one-third lower than the corresponding period last year, with the decline projected at 25% in February (see graphic).

Despite the supply gap, states are, however, reluctant to lift imported onions to bridge the deficit on account of damage to the crop in the wake of heavy rains in Maharashtra and Karnataka.

Sources said till now about 12,000 tonnes of imported onion arrived of the total 41,950 tonnes contracted by the state-run trading agency MMTC. "States have lifted only 3,000 tonnes," said a source. Union consumer affairs secretary AK Srivastava admitted that the states were not picking up stocks, although they had earlier committed to buy more. "On the basis of their demand of 33,000 tonnes, the government had gone ahead with the plan to import 41,950 tonnes. But now their demand has fallen by half to only 14309 tonnes," he said.

Srivastava said the issue of states hesitating to lift imported onion was discussed at a meeting chaired by cabinet secretary Rajiv Gauba on Tuesday. Union consumer affairs minister Ram Vilas Paswan said the Centre will now sell imported onion to states at Rs 49-58 per kg for retail distribution to check prices.

"We have imported so far 12,000 tonnes of onion from countries like Turkey and Afghanistan. Of this, 1,000 tonnes have already been distributed to states," he said.

Title: Former Assam CM Prafulla Mahanta not allowed to hold meet at AGP HQ
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Former Assam CM Prafulla Mahanta (ANI photo)

GUWAHATI: The rift in Asom Gana Parishad (AGP) over the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) came out in public once again on Tuesday as former chief minister Prafulla Kumar Mahanta was not allowed to hold a meeting at the party's headquarters in Guwahati. Mahanta was forced to shift his meeting to another venue.

AGP, which is in alliance with BJP, has been divided on the CAA, which grants citizenship to non-Muslims from Bangladesh, Pakistan and Afghanistan.

Mahanta and his followers have been against the legislation, while party president Atul Bora and his other two party colleagues in the government, Keshab Mahanta and Phani Bhushan Choudhury, the lone Rajya Sabha member from AGP Birendra Prasad Baishya, are on theother side.

On Tuesday, Mahanta was in for a surprise when he reached the party headquarters for holding an interactive session with grassroots level workers only to find a huge lock at the gate. Security personnel posted outside the gate told Mahanta and his followers to back off.

Mahanta did hold the meet, but it had to be rescheduled by a few hours to another venue. In his speech, Mahanta told his supporters, "Those supporting CAA in AGP must join BJP. AGP had earlier taken a resolution opposing CAA ."

Mahanta was accompanied by legislator Pabindra Deka and former party president Brindaban Goswami.

Deka appealed to party workers to be united and resolutely oppose CAA. In the meeting, workers urged Mahanta and those backing him to take a resolution against the party leadership, who have been backing the CAA.

Title: NHAI to remove speed breakers at toll plazas
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

File photo for representation

NEW DELHI: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has launched a special drive to remove all sorts of speed breakers and rumble strips on NH network, particularly at the toll plazas as the number of vehicles with FASTag has increased manifold in the past couple of months.

The authority has also directed all officials to intensify activities to push sale of the smart tags and to address any glitches at the toll plazas in the next two weeks.

In a statement the NHAI said removal of speed breakers will ensure smooth and hassle-free vehicle movement . "Roads of different categories and under different situations are designed for designated speeds at which vehicles can travel with convenience and safety. At certain locations, control of speed becomes necessary for orderly traffic movement and safety," the authority said.

Title: Kota blame-game gets new twist
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Children being treated at the JK Lon Hospital in Kota. (PTI photo)

JAIPUR: More skeletons are tumbling out of JK Lon Hospital in Kota where more than 112 children have died in the last 37 days.

When Rajasthan health minister Raghu Sharma directed the authorities to take stock of medical equipment being used in state government hospitals, it was found that Chinese medical equipment of inferior grade were being used. "I have directed additional chief secretary (health) Rohit Kumar Singh to investigate the matter and find out who is behind the purchase of such equipment," Sharma told reporters on Tuesday.

"Whoever is behind it is playing with the health of children. For saving the lives of children, inferior Chinese medical equipment was purchased, which might put the health of children at risk," he said.

A complete report will be prepared and submitted to the health minister. Sharma also issued directions that a centralised system for monitoring medical equipment be developed. TOI had published a report, "Over 50% of gadgets in Kota hospital where kids died defunct", on December 30. Now a system will be put in place to record monitoring requirements, purchase and maintenance of medical equipment.

Another shortcoming at J K Lon Hospital was the absence of a centralised oxygen system . Oxygen cylinders are supplied to the hospital by cart. The health minister has directed officials to identify all hospitals in the state that lack a centralised oxygen system. "We will install centralised oxygen systems in all hospitals in a phase-wise manner," said Sharma.

Title: Army chief to visit Siachen this week
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Army chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: In his first outstation visit after taking over as the Army chief on December 31, General Manoj Mukund Naravane will be visiting the Siachen Glacier-Saltoro Ridge region facing Pakistan as well as Daulat Beg Oldi (DBO) opposite the Line of Actual Control with China.

Gen Naravane will be visiting the areas for a first-hand assessment of the operational situation on Thursday and Friday. "He will land at the Siachen base camp and also go to some forward posts, while overflying other forward areas like in the sub sector north," said a source.

The Army chief 's visit to the "super high-altitude areas" also comes after six soldiers and two civilian porters were killed in separate incidents due to avalanches in the Siachen Glacier in November. Over 1,000 Indian soldiers, including over 35 officers, have lost their lives in the Siachen Glacier-Saltoro Ridge region since April 1984, when India's Operation Meghdhoot pre-empted Pakistan's Operation Ababeel to occupy almost all the dominating heights from 16,000 to 22,000-feet by a whisker.

Around three-fourths of the casualties are caused by the severe terrain and climatic conditions there.

Title: PM Modi changed political narrative: Amit Shah
Content:
BJP chief Amit Shah (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: BJP chief Amit Shah on Tuesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi believed in delivering what was required for society without bothering about popularity ratings, adding that the Centre had taken several bold decisions which successive governments didn't dare to take for reasons like appeasement or vote bank politics "Modi has acted against three curses of Indian politics - appeasement, casteism and nepotism. This government works on efficiency and by keeping welfare of the people as the guiding principle, rather than vote bank politics. India has not seen a leader like Modi who takes strong decisions, in the interest of the nation and its people, without fearing backlash," Shah said.After releasing a book 'Karmayoddha Granth' on the life of Modi, Shah said the PM was the epitome of selfless service. He added that the government's decisions had shaped a strong image of India globally and Modi had revamped India's foreign policy and national security policy by de-linking the two."India emerged as a strong nation on the global stage while making its stance clear that India will not take attacks on itself lying down. India has emerged as a global power by taking bold decisions, including removal of Articles 370 and 35A in J&K, bringing Citizenship Amendment Act , resolution of Ram Mandir issue, criminalising triple talaq, conducting surgical strikes and Balakot air strikes , which nobody dared in the last 70 years," the BJP chief said.Shah said Modi had not only changed the political narrative by keeping the party manifesto at the centre of regovernance but had also taken tough decisions for people's welfare without caring about the consequences."The government is functioning on an ideology which keeps Deen Dayal Upadhyay's 'Antyodaya' at the centre," he added.Sharing his experience of working with Modi, Shah talked about the three phases of the PM's life, starting from dedicating his life to an ideology, entering politics on the ideals of the "sangathan", and finally upholding the tenets of parliamentary democracy and the Constitution to construct a welfare state."Modiji's childhood was devoid of luxury, full of poverty, disadvantages and neglect from society but he has dedicated his life towards the welfare of people, without having any ill-feeling for anyone in society," Shah said.He added that the Modi government had inherited a government plagued with corruption but had delivered a non-corruptible government since 2014, laying the foundation for a new India.

Title: PM Modi changed political narrative: Amit Shah
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

BJP chief Amit Shah (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: BJP chief Amit Shah on Tuesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi believed in delivering what was required for society without bothering about popularity ratings, adding that the Centre had taken several bold decisions which successive governments didn't dare to take for reasons like appeasement or vote bank politics .

"Modi has acted against three curses of Indian politics - appeasement, casteism and nepotism. This government works on efficiency and by keeping welfare of the people as the guiding principle, rather than vote bank politics. India has not seen a leader like Modi who takes strong decisions, in the interest of the nation and its people, without fearing backlash," Shah said.

After releasing a book 'Karmayoddha Granth' on the life of Modi, Shah said the PM was the epitome of selfless service. He added that the government's decisions had shaped a strong image of India globally and Modi had revamped India's foreign policy and national security policy by de-linking the two.

"India emerged as a strong nation on the global stage while making its stance clear that India will not take attacks on itself lying down. India has emerged as a global power by taking bold decisions, including removal of Articles 370 and 35A in J&K, bringing Citizenship Amendment Act , resolution of Ram Mandir issue, criminalising triple talaq, conducting surgical strikes and Balakot air strikes , which nobody dared in the last 70 years," the BJP chief said.

Shah said Modi had not only changed the political narrative by keeping the party manifesto at the centre of regovernance but had also taken tough decisions for people's welfare without caring about the consequences.

"The government is functioning on an ideology which keeps Deen Dayal Upadhyay's 'Antyodaya' at the centre," he added.

Sharing his experience of working with Modi, Shah talked about the three phases of the PM's life, starting from dedicating his life to an ideology, entering politics on the ideals of the "sangathan", and finally upholding the tenets of parliamentary democracy and the Constitution to construct a welfare state.

"Modiji's childhood was devoid of luxury, full of poverty, disadvantages and neglect from society but he has dedicated his life towards the welfare of people, without having any ill-feeling for anyone in society," Shah said.

He added that the Modi government had inherited a government plagued with corruption but had delivered a non-corruptible government since 2014, laying the foundation for a new India.

Title: I-T case: HC rejects Karti Chidambaram's discharge plea
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Karti Chidambaram (TOI photo)

CHENNAI: In a legal setback to former Union minister P Chidambaram 's son, Karti Chidambaram , an MP from Sivaganga constituency, a special court has declined to discharge him and his wife Srinidhi from an income tax prosecution for non-disclosure of income .

Rejecting their pleas on Tuesday, special judge D Lingeshwaran directed the couple to be present in court on January 21 for framing of charges and made it clear that if they failed to appear on the next hearing date, the court would have to issue warrants against them.

Special public prosecutor M Sheela submitted that Karti, his wife Srinidhi, and his mother Nalini Chidambaram had sold their lands at Muttukadu, near Chennai, to Agni Estates and Foundations Pvt Ltd at Rs 4.25 crore per acre.

As per the complaint made, Karti had not disclosed the receipt of the cash component in his income tax return for assessment year 2014-15 and Srinidhi in her return for the assessment year 2015-16.

Moving the plea to discharge him, Karti submitted that the alleged cash payments were made only three months after the accused had filed his income tax returns for assessment year 2014-15. Therefore, he said, on the date of filing his return he had not received the cash.

Title: Government mulls tax break for desi pharma companies
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

(Representative image)

NEW DELHI: In a move to boost research in drug manufacturing , the government is considering to restore tax benefits on research and development (R&D) expenditure incurred by local pharmaceutical companies in the upcoming Budget 2020 .

This is one of the key recommendations made by the department of pharmaceuticals (DoP) as part of its budget proposal to the finance ministry, an official source said. The pharmaceutical industry is hopeful that the government will restore the weighted deduction on expenditure incurred on R&D to 200%.

At present, the industry enjoys 150% weighted deduction on R&D but it is scheduled to come down to 100% from 2020 unless the government takes a call on it.

The government had introduced a weighted tax deduction of 200% on expenditure on R&D in the 2010 budget, in order to boost innovation in the country. However, the government slashed the benefit to 150% from 2017 onwards and 100% from 2020.

Besides the deduction on research, the department has also suggested offering some incentives to encourage domestic manufacturing of bulk drugs or Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) used as raw material in the formulation of medicine.

Title: Brand-new SC bench for Sabarimala
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

NEW DELHI: The nine-judge bench that will decide petitions seeking review of the Supreme Court's decision allowing entry of women in the 10-50 year age group into Sabarimala Ayyappa temple does not include any judge who was part of earlier benches which dealt with the matter.

On September 28, 2018, the order to quash the traditional ban on entry of women into the temple was delivered by then CJI Dipak Misra and Justices RF Nariman, AM Khanwilkar, DY Chandrachud and Indu Malhotra. On October 2, 2018, CJI Misra retired.

The review petitions were decided on November 14 last year by a bench of the then CJI Ranjan Gogoi and the other four judges who were part of the original bench. By a three to two majority, the bench referred the issue, including laying down the guidelines for adjudication of cases involving a clash between faith and fundamental rights , to a seven-judge bench.

However, on Monday, CJI SA Bobde entrusted the task to a nine-judge bench headed by him. Others on the bench are Justices R Banumathi, Ashok Bhushan, L Nageswara Rao, Mohan M Shantanagoudar, S Abdul Nazeer, R Subhash Reddy, BR Gavai and Surya Kant.

On September 28, 2018, the SC had by four to one majority termed the custom unconstitutional and had thrown open the Sabarimala temple to women of all ages. Justice Malhotra was the lone dissenting voice who said courts should not interfere with faith and customs of a religion. More than 50 review petitions were filed against the decision.

Title: Cops book woman with 'Free Kashmir' placard
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Mehak Mirza Prabhu holds a poster reading 'Free Kashmir' in Mumbai during a protest against the violence at JN... Read More

MUMBAI: The Colaba police on Tuesday evening filed an FIR against Mehak Mirza Prabhu, the woman protester at the Gateway of India whose placard reading 'Free Kashmir' kicked up a storm with former CM Devendra Fadnavis and others alleging the agitation in support of JNU students had taken on a divisive character.

Mehak, who had participated in the protest on Monday, was booked under Section 153B of the Indian Penal Code for imputations and assertions prejudicial to national integration. No arrest has been made. If convicted, an accused booked under this charge could face imprisonment for a maximum of five years.

The FIR was filed suo moto by Colaba police. It came after home minister Anil Deshmukh of the NCP said earlier in the day that the state would carry out a probe into the matter and after Shiv Sena and NCP leaders had defended Mehak.

The woman herself sought to clarify her position in a video she put out on social media and in a chat with TOI, saying she was speaking only of "basic constitutional rights" and "freedom of expression" in J&K in view of the "internet shutdown" there.

A senior police officer said they would examine Mehak's profile on social media. "We have to scan all the information about her in order to establish in what context she was carrying the poster," an IPS officer said on Tuesday afternoon.

Speaking about what she termed as the "abuse, hate and narrative" that the image of her holding up the poster had spawned, Mehak told TOI, "I have been in too much distress. I'm an artiste, I tell stories and I was there like everyone else with no other agenda. I did not write or create that poster. It was lying around, which I happened to lift and hold up."

Stating that things had been "blown out of proportion" and she had been labelled as a "member of a gang," the 37-year-old stressed on her background as a Maharashtrian and a storytelling artiste. "The picture created by social media came as an absolute shock to me," she said. "If by being naive in understanding the impact it would have, and in the process (having) created this stir, I apologise. As a woman it is scary for my safety."

Title: SC to government: Look into notes with jihadi messages
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Union government told the Supreme Court on Tuesday that it will examine allegations in a PIL that the Reserve Bank of India 's Jammu branch had, in contravention of rules, exchanged currency notes worth Rs 30 crore which were embossed with Kashmiri separatist slogans .

On a petition filed by Amritsar-based Satish Bharadwaj, a bench of Chief Justice S A Bobde and Justices BR Gavai and Surya Kant asked solicitor general Tushar Mehta whether "central agencies have done anything on this issue"? The bench asked the SG whether the court should issue notice to the Centre or it would examine the matter on its own. When Mehta said the government would look into it, the bench adjourned hearing on the petition.

Quoting a TOI report of August 19, 2013, from Srinagar which said separatist slogans were being stamped on Indian currency notes, the petitioner said he inquired and found that "defaced/imperfect Indian currency notes worth Rs 30 crore were exchanged with fresh currency notes by Jammu regional branch office of RBI on the instruction of then regional director of Jammu branch of RBI". The money allegedly belonged to a separatist group.

Bharadwaj said exchange of defaced currency notes was against the RBI (Note Refund) Rules, 2009, which stipulate that "no claim can be made against any currency notes which is imperfect or mutilated, or which carry any extrinsic words or visible representation which is intended to convey any message of a political or religious character or furthering the interest of any person or entity".

Seeking a CBI inquiry into the matter, Bharadwaj said embossing notes with separatist slogans by militant groups was "an act to disrupt law and order and destabilise India by creating an environment of tension and terror ". Bharadwaj said he had sought informationnon the matter from the RBI in February last year but the bank termed the query to be in the nature of "opinion/justification/reason".

Title: Jammu man arrested for sharing vital information on Facebook
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

JAMMU: A resident of the border town of Arnia in Jammu district was arrested for espionage after allegedly sharing vital details on Facebook .

On January 3, police arrested two men - Rakesh Kumar and Vijay Kumar - of Powal village in Arnia sector. "Vijay Kumar was released after questioning and verification and a case of espionage stands registered against Rakesh Kumar under the Enemy Agents Ordinance , 2005," a police officer said.

The local police and other agencies are investigating the matter.

Title: Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist, 17, killed in J&K encounter after refusing to surrender
Content: SRINAGAR: A 17-year-old Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist was killed in an anti-terror operation in Awantipora area of south Kashmir's Pulwama district on Tuesday after he refused to surrender but chose to engage the security forces in a gunbattle instead, police said.This is the first encounter in Kashmir in the past 40 days. The last firefight took place in Pulwama's Drabgam area on November 26, where two Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed. Police said the slain terrorist was a resident of Arwani area of Bijbehara in Anantnag district. He had gone missing last week and taken up arms.A video recording of the encounter site shows the 17-year-old's father and relatives urging him to come out of hiding and surrender. "Your mother is dying, I will give you whatever you need and want, please come out," his father pleads. The teen, however, doesn't respond.Based on intelligence inputs about the presence of the terrorist, security forces had launched a cordon-and-search operation in Chursoo village early on Tuesday. "The holed-up terrorist was given ample chance to surrender but refused to do so. He opened fire at the search party instead, triggering an encounter," said a police spokesperson, adding that the 17-year-old was killed in the ensuing gunfight.Arms and ammunition were also recovered from the encounter site, Jammu and Kashmir Police confirmed in a tweet.In Video: 17-year-old Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist killed in J&K encounter after refusing to surrender

Title: Varun Dhawan on JNU attack: Can't stay neutral on such issues
Content: Actor Varun Dhawan on Tuesday condemned the violence in Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) and said one cannot stay neutral during such incidents, joining a section of Bollywood personalities who have denounced the campus mayhem.Violence had broken out inside the university campus on Sunday night as masked men armed with sticks and rods attacked students and teachers and damaged property. At least 34 people, including JNU Students' Union president Aishe Ghosh, were injured.Speaking to reporters here in Madhya Pradesh while promoting his upcoming film, Dhawan said, "I think we cannot stay neutral in such issues. You have to condemn such attacks."It is dangerous and sad if masked people enter an educational institution and all this (assault, vandalism) happens."Queried on whether there was a "divide" in the Hindi film industry on the incident going by the vast number of tweets and posts on social media from the fraternity, the 32- year-old actor evaded a direct reply and said, "I am not going to get into what people are saying on Twitter on this issue."He feigned ignorance when asked about tweets against the Centre on the JNU violence by producer-director Anurag Kashyap , and said "I have been promoting my film for the past three days and have not read statements of these people".The 'Badlapur' actor said it was not known, right now, who was behind Sunday's violence inside the premier central varsity."But the police will investigate it. As an Indian, I have full faith in the police and judiciary. I hope those involved in this incident get severe punishment as soon as possible," he said.Dhawan said everybody, especially parents, wanted students to remain safe in campuses, adding that the need now was for peace and stability and for all people to act unitedly."It is easy to sit here and say whether this or that man is wrong," he added."Horrifying", "heartbreaking" and "barbaric" is how voices emerging from Bollywood such as director Zoya Akhtar , actors Anil Kapoor and Alia Bhatt on Monday described the JNU violence and demanded that the perpetrators be brought to justice.

Title: 'Anarchists are raising Free Kashmir slogans'
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

NEW DELHI: Information and broadcasting minister Prakash Javadekar said on Tuesday "masked" men involved in the JNU attack will be exposed soon. Talking to reporters on the sidelines of the first International Yoga Day Media Awards, Javadekar also said a misunderstanding over JNU was deliberately being spread in the varsity and others parts of the country to incite violence.

Javadekar also claimed selective "anarchists" were raising slogans for a "Free Kashmir" even though "the entire country" supported revocation of Article 370 in Jammu & Kashmir. He said Kashmir remains an inseparable part of India and claimed that peace "has been prevailing" in J&K and that the region is "making progress since Article 370 of the Constitution was repealed".

"The entire country is supporting the move... a few selective anarchists are raising such kind of slogans. Nobody even inside Kashmir raised such slogans. Now if someone outside the region gives such slogan, that makes no sense," Javadekar further said.

Conferring the Yoga Day Media Awards, Javadekar said the honouor was instituted to felicitate media organisations that had contributed to spread yoga as beneficial to society. He appreciated efforts by the media and said the event, the first of its kind, marked a new trend of recognising the endeavour of media organisations going beyond news, views and advertisements.

Referring to yoga as an Indian brand that has gained global respect due to PM Modi'sefforts, Javadekar said the United Nations supported India's proposal for an International Day of Yoga.

Title: Government may link GST refund to remittance for risky exporters
Content:
(File photo)

NEW DELHI: The government is looking at linking the refund of goods and services tax ( GST ) to "risky and new" exporters with remittance of foreign exchange apart from accessing bank transaction details as part of an exercise to plug revenue leakage.The issues were discussed at a meeting of top tax officers with revenue secretary AB Pandey on Tuesday, where it was decided to put in place a standard operating procedure (SOP) to fix fraudulent refund claims , including those related to sectors where the final product has higher GST than inputs and raw materials.A committee of state and central officers has been tasked with finalising the SOP within a week so that it can be implemented by the end of the month.To ensure better scrutiny of data, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) will enter into an arrangement to share data with GST Network (GSTN) and Central Board of Direct Taxes ( CBDT ) on a quarterly basis, instead of the current mechanism of an online exchange, an official release said.This will help in profiling those indulging in frauds. Data analysis has already helped in detecting widespread GST evasion, especially fraudulent refunds by fly-bynight operators. The recent investigation of Integrated GST refunds to exporters has prompted GST officers to look at new ways to protect revenue. One of the suggestions is to mandate a single bank account for foreign remittance receipt and refund disbursement for better tracking, although businesses said that the move was intrusive and would burden the entire industry due to the fault of a few entities.The officers also decided to explore access to banking transactions, including the bank account details by GST system, in consultation with RBI and NPCI. "It was also explored to make GST system aligned with Financial Intelligence Unit for the purpose of getting bank account details and transactions and also PAN-based banking transaction," the statement said.Besides, all major cases of fake tax credit on inputs, export-import frauds and fraudulent refunds will also be probed by investigation wing of the income tax department.

Title: Bihar: 'Textbooks to be digitized'
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: State project director of Bihar Education Project Council (BEPC), Sanjay Kumar Singh, on Tuesday said the education department had been working towards digitization of all textbooks .

Speaking at a function organized to launch ‘Diksha’, an online portal of the State Council of Educational Research and Training (SCERT), Singh claimed that several mechanisms had been developed to provide quality education in government schools. “With the help of digital books, videos and online content, the teaching and learning outcomes will improve,” he said.

With ‘Diksha’, government schoolteachers will now have access to better resources for planning classroom activities. It will offer them engaging material relevant to the prescribed school curricula.

“We are planning to integrate the Educational Management Information System (EMIS) with ‘Diksha’ in future. An initiative of the BEPC, EMIS contains information like number of government schools, teachers, students, infrastructure and implementation of schemes,” the BEPC state project director said.

Singh also promised that the state government would provide funds to develop a digital content lab on the SCERT premises in Mahendru.

SCERT director Vinod Kumar Singh threw light on the features of ‘Diksha’, saying, “It is an initiative of the Centre, which many states, including Bihar, have adopted. Students can download ‘Diksha’ and scan the QR codes in their textbooks.”

Title: Nagpur: Dozens barred from Standard I admissions
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Dozens of students in Nagpur won’t be able to secure admission in Std I in the 2020-21 academic session as they won’t turn six years of age by October 15, which is the most important criteria for admission.

The fault lies with schools which admitted these children a few years ago at nursery/KG level even though it was clear that they won’t turn six by the time they reach Std I. This never came up on the scanner because the education department’s control over schools start from Std I only. Now, the only option for those students is to repeat KG II and seek admission in Std I next year.

The state government introduced the minimum age criteria in a phased manner from the 2016-17 academic session with six years criteria being implemented from the current academic session.

Chintaman Vanjari, education officer ( Nagpur district ), said “Even last year we had a few cases like this. Students will have to repeat their kindergarten level because we cannot allow admissions in Std I if the child does not meet the age criteria.”

As per the earlier guidelines laid down by the education department, students should have completed six years of age on September 30 during the session when they take admission. A recent government resolution has allowed a relief of two weeks (October 15) for being able to complete the age criteria.

Some schools, mostly ‘budget’ ones, admitted students at pre-school level either due to ignorance or just to avoid missing out on admissions. Now three years later, such students find themselves stuck as they enter the ‘formal education’ phase of their lives.

Dipendra Lokhande, education officer (Chandrapur district), said “The data of all students being admitted in Std I is entered in a government portal. If the age criteria is not met, then the system won’t allow that admission. This portal, known by the acronym SARAL, exists only in Maharashtra and provides us a complete overview of statistics related to school education in the state.”

For education activists, the problem is who will pay the fee of such students who have to repeat KG II. Mohd Shahid Sharif, an education activist, said, “Parents are coming to our office and complaining about fees to be paid all over again. This is unfair to them as it is the responsibility of the school to ensure that all documentation is proper. Many times, parents are not aware of all the rules.”

Title: New degree format in Patna University
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Patna University

PATNA: Patna University (PU) has, of late, initiated several measures for ensuring better management of student-centric activities.

In a first, the size and format of degrees awarded to students after successful completion of their courses of studies have been changed in such a way that it would be easier to carry them. The practice of awarding huge-size degrees written in English only (Hindi version on demand and submission of additional fee) has been stopped and instead an A4 size degree containing both Hindi and English version on the same page has been introduced.

“The new degree format will also contain photograph of the candidate and his or her unique ID. Faking degrees and certificates will be very difficult now,” said a PU official. All the PU scholars received their degrees in new format at the convocation held on Saturday.

In another initiative, PU has strengthened its counselling, training and placement cell for providing the much-needed career counselling and securing jobs to the passouts of both conventional and vocational (self-financing) courses. “For the first time in 2019, several big companies visited the university and selected students from different institutions on the basis of written test and interview,” said PU vice-chancellor Rash Bihari Prasad Singh.

Quite recently, a full-fledged career centre was established on the campus with a view to enhancing the employability skills and providing necessary information to students about job avenues in different sectors. An MoU to this effect was signed between the PU’s placement cell and Medha Learning Foundation.

Title: Bihar: Couple among six killed in 4 districts
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

MOTIHARI/PATNA: Altogether six people, including a couple, were killed in separate incidents in East Champaran , Saharsa, Darbhanga and Sheohar districts during the last 24 hours on Tuesday.

In Champaran , one Tabrej Alam (25) and his 20-year-old wife Hashminesha were killed in Chhapra Bahas village under Sugauli police station area on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday. The incident came to light on Tuesday morning when the family members opened the room and found them lying in a pool of blood.

Tabrej’s brother R Alam told the police that the couple was sleeping in a room on the ground floor, while he along with his father and mother was in another room on the first floor of the building. “My mother knocked the couple’s door when they didn’t wake up in the morning. Their throats were slit with sharp-edged weapons,” Alam said.

The couple’s body was covered with a blanket to show as if they were sleeping. Tabrej, a daily wager, had married Hashminesha last year. The family told the investigating officer that Hashminesha was pregnant. The family suspected the involvement of a villager, who was not on good terms with the deceased.

Motihari ASP Vinit Kumar said an FSL team visited the site and collected evidences. The bodies were handed over to the family after postmortem. An FIR was lodged on the statement of Alam.

In another incident, one Amik Mandal (50) was shot by unidentified criminals in Dotara village under Basnahi police station area in Saharsa district late Monday night. The assailants fired at Mandal when he was sitting on the veranda of his outhouse around 9.30pm. He was rushed to the local primary health centre where he was declared brought dead.

In another incident in Saharsa, one Mantosh Thakur was stabbed to death by unidentified miscreants near a cinema hall under the Sadar police station in the town. Saharsa SP Rakesh Kumar said property dispute was stated to be the reason behind the two murders. One Anup Mandal was detained for interrogation in connection with the killing of Amik.

A report from Sheohar said one Bindeshwari Singh (70) was shot dead by unidentified criminals on Sundarpur-Harauna road under Tariyani police station area on Tuesday. Police said the incident took place when the deceased was returning home from the local market on a motorbike. Tariyani police station SHO Sudama Rai said the deceased belonged to Harnahi and had old enmity with a local resident.

In Darbhanga, the Mabbi police recovered the bullet-riddled body of a 14-year-old boy Om Prakash from Karharia rivulet on Tuesday. Darbhanga SSP Babu Ram said two minor boys have been taken into custody in connection with the incident.

Title: Abir and Sohini reunite for Pavel’s family drama
Content: They are one of the most popular on-screen jodis of Tollywood. And now, the hit pair of Byomkesh and Satyabati will be seen in an all-new avatar in Pavel’s next film — a family drama. We heard Abir Chatterjee and Sohini Sarkar have already blocked their dates around end of March and April. Said a source close to the development, “Pavel had initially thought of making a musical extravaganza with the duo on a grand scale. But it had to be pushed back by a year because the execution involves certain challenges. So, he came up with this family drama, as the actors had already blocked their dates for him. The film will go on the floors from April.”Though Pavel chose to remain tight-lipped about the project, the director didn’t deny the fact that he is planning a film with Abir and Sohini. “It is too early to talk about the film,” he told us. Abir and Sohini will also be seen together in Indraadip Das Gupta’s Agantuk , which chronicles the life of an elderly woman, who is found dead at her residence one morning. The shooting for the film is already complete.

Title: R-Power defaults, lenders face insolvency deadline
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Mumbai: Reliance Power on Tuesday informed the stock exchanges that it has defaulted on a debt of Rs 685 crore. The company said that the default pertained to the quarter ended December 2019.

On July 6, 2019, all the main lenders of Reliance Power had signed an inter-creditor agreement (ICA). Based on the ICA , lenders had agreed to a six-month standstill, during which they would not initiate recovery of their loans. The objective of the standstill agreement was to implement a resolution plan during the same period. Reliance Power’s default has coincided with the expiry of the 210-day deadline set by the RBI for resolving all stressed loans through an inter-creditor agreement allowed under the central bank’s June 6, 2019 circular. In terms of the circular, if banks failed to arrive at a resolution by January 7, they would have to either initiate insolvency proceedings or set aside as additional provisions, 20% of the stressed loan.

Lenders, through Indian Banks Association, have sought more time from the RBI to complete resolutions of some stressed loans, including loans to the power sector. They have said that their efforts would go waste if they are forced to abandon the resolution discussions and initiate insolvency proceedings because of the deadline expiry. In July 2019, rating agency ICRA had downgraded the company from ‘C’ with a tag ‘issuer non-cooperating’ to ‘D’ on confirmation of delays in debt servicing. “The liquidity profile of the company, along with its subsidiaries, continues to remain stretched as evident from the considerable decline in the net cash accruals in FY19 and net-worth erosion due to significant impairment of assets,” ICRA had said.

R-Power, a part of the Reliance Group promoted by Anil Ambani, is the primary vehicle for investments in the power generation sector.

The company’s generation capacity stood at 5,945 MW, including 5,760 MW of thermal capacity and 185 MW of renewable energy-based capacity. Its operational projects include Rosa Project at Shahajahnapur, Uttar Pradesh (1,200 MW); Butibori Project at Nagpur, Maharashtra (600 MW), UMPP at Sasan (3,960 MW); solar PV Project at Dhursar, Rajasthan (40 MW), concentrated solar power project at Pokhran, Rajasthan (100 MW) and wind project at Vashpet, Maharashtra (45 MW).

Title: Religare Finvest debt deal to be test case for lenders
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Mayur Shetty | TNN

Mumbai: The debt resolution of Religare Enterprises’s troubled finance arm Religare Finvest through the sale of the company to the Chatterjee group’s TCG Advisory Services is likely to be a test case for RBI ’s inter-creditor agreement (ICA).

This is the first instance of a debt resolution being approved under the ICA platform in terms of RBI’s June 7, 2019 circular with 25% of lenders dissenting.

Under the inter-creditor agreement, three fourths of the lenders to Religare Finvest have agreed to a resolution proposal where Religare Enterprises will divest its entire stake in Religare Finvest to TCG Advisory Services. In a notice to the stock exchange, the company said that it now has until under March 3, 2020, as against December 2019 earlier, to finalise the deal.

What makes this a test case is that until now most resolutions through inter-creditor agreement have involved all of them agreeing to a resolution plan. The ICA is a platform where lenders can enter into a settlement with defaulting management without initiating insolvency proceedings. The RBI allows a deal to be approved if 75% of lenders by value and 60% by number agree on a resolution plan. However, the circular also requires that majority lenders protect rights of dissenting lenders by paying them at least the liquidation value. However, it is not clear who will pay the dissenting lenders.

Punjab National Bank and Bank of Baroda and the banks that will merge into them who together account for less than 25% of the debt have not approved the deal. “The way assenting creditors compensate the dissenting creditors will set a precedent for other similar case which has dissenting creditors,” said a senior bank official.

“If the dissenting lenders are not treated fairly, they could exercise their right to move bankruptcy court which would negate all the attempts put by lenders and new owners to revive the company,” added the senior official.

According to one of the lenders, the plan is to split the total debt crore into sustainable and unsustainable in the ratio of 51:49. Servicing the debt entails additional funding of Rs 3,000 crore over the next three years. The new promoter TPG will bring in Rs 330-odd crore upfront and additional funds every year with a total commitment of close to Rs 1,000 crore.

Title: Das: Operation twist impact as expected
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Mumbai: RBI governor Shaktikanta Das on Tuesday said the market’s response to the central bank’s ‘ operation twist ’, was on expected lines. “The response to the two rounds of simultaneous buying and selling of government securities through OMOs (open market operations) is on expected lines,” Das said on the sidelines of an event at the central bank’s headquarters.

Das was referring to the process through which the RBI has started simultaneously buying government securities of 10-year tenure and selling short-term bonds of less than one year tenure, worth exactly the same amount. This is done to forcibly soften the benchmark yield on 10-year gilts, which is one of the main determinants of the lending rate by banks. However, by buying and selling government bonds worth same amount of money, such an operation does not impact the liquidity in the system.

Starting on December 23, the RBI has conducted three such operations, buying and selling gilts worth about Rs 10,000 crore. The benchmark yield has come down by about 20 basis points to 6.55% as of Tuesday. While the results of the first two were on expected lines, the impact of the third one is being evaluated, sources said.

Title: NOU and BRABU likely to get new VCs by month-end
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

PATNA: Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar Bihar University (BRABU) in Muzaffarpur and Nalanda Open University (NOU) in Patna will soon get full-time vice-chancellors (VC). Magadh University (MU) in Bodh Gaya, on the other hand, will have a new pro-VC. The process for their appointment has begun and is likely to be finalized by the end of this month.

According to Raj Bhavan sources, the applications received for the posts of VCs and pro-VC of the three universities have already been screened by the chancellor’s secretariat. The shortlisted candidates have been called for interaction with the duly constituted search committee on January 19 and 20. After the committee submits the names recommended by it, the new appointments will be made by the chancellor in consultation with the chief minister.

Both BRABU and NOU have been functioning without regular VCs for the past few months. While the office of the VC in BRABU fell vacant when he was asked by the chancellor to resign few months ago, NOU VC Ravindra Kumar Sinha resigned on his own to join another university in Jammu. For some time, Purnea University VC Rajesh Singh was asked to officiate as the VC of BRABU, but he was soon replaced by pro-VC R K Mandal of the same university. Similarly, Patna University (PU) VC Rash Bihari Prasad Singh was made to officiate as the VC of NOU after the resignation of Sinha, but was replaced by Patliputra University VC Gulab Chand Ram Jaiswal.

The posts of VCs in Tilka Manjhi Bhagalpur University (TMBU), Lalit Narayan Mithila University (LNMU) and Jai Prakash University (JPU) have also been advertised by the chancellor’s secretariat. The last date for receipt of online applications ended on November 30 and their screening is reportedly going on. While TMBU is going without a regular VC for the past few months, the term of present incumbents in LNMU and JPU is likely to expire soon. JPU VC Harikesh Singh will complete his three-year term on January 24 and LNMU VC S K Singh will do so on March 20.

“In the coming months, the posts of VCs and pro-VCs of some more universities, including PU, will be advertised as the incumbents will complete their three-year terms shortly,” said sources.

Title: Two held for looting trucks, goods
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Agra: Two members of an inter-state gang involved in looting trucks were arrested by Agra police and Rs 10 lakh worth pesticide seized from them. Two of their accomplices are on the run.

According to police, a month ago, a truck was stolen from a fuel station in Shamshabad area. While investigating the case, police found various CCTV footage of the truck which was seen heading towards Firozabad along with a SUV tailing it.

“The SUV belonged to family of one of the gang members. The police conducted a raid and arrested two men -- Raees (35), a resident of Hajipura, and Shahid (40) of Chamiya Tola under Rasoolpur police jurisdiction. Raees’ family runs a wholesale business of fruits. During interrogation, the accused confessed that they ran a gang of vehicle-lifters. The gang would steal or loot a truck laden with goods standing idle on the road side or parked at a fuel station. The gang recently stole Rs 10 lakh worth pesticide along with a truck from Karhal of Mainpuri district. We have recovered the pesticide from Khandauli- based godown,” said Arvind Kumar Nirval, SHO of Shamshabad.

“Two prime suspects -- Kuldeep Yadav and Mujaheed -- are still absconding. The gang sold the stolen goods in the local market, while using the trucks for their transport business. They would sell the vehicles to neighbouring states like Rajasthan and Delhi. Shahid, who was arrested, was earlier nabbed in Haldwani, Uttarakhand for vehicle- lifting,” added the SHO.

Meanwhile, Ganjdundwara police of Kasganj arrested three vehicle-lifters and seized a truck and two motorcycles from them. Those arrested were identified as Shahwaz, Tahir Hussain and Babloo.

Title: Gold prices soar to all-time high
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

PATNA: Gold is glittering like never before. Geopolitical uncertainties and tension in the Middle East are likely to add further shine to the yellow metal, which was selling at Rs41,110 per 10gm (24 carat) in the city on Tuesday, the highest price so far. Also, 22 carat gold, which is mainly used in making jewellery, was sold at Rs39,150 per 10gm, with slight variations in its prices at different outlets.

Bullion traders claimed that surging gold prices are unlikely to hit the sales, especially when wedding season is to start from January 16. “Even though the prices of gold are increasing, it is not having much impact on sales as people buy and wear gold jewellery during wedding season owing to tradition,” said Jeevan Kumar, state secretary of Akhil Bhartiya Swarnkar Sangh.

Mohit Khemka, who owns a jewellery shop at Boring Road, also had similar views. “Though we were expecting a dull period in the coming wedding season due to rising gold prices, but it does not seem to be the case. There is no fall in the number of customers purchasing gold for wedding purposes. As usual, we are getting five to six such customers every day,” Khemka said, adding that many people are also investing in gold in the hope of further rise in its prices.

Even the buyers think so. Saguna Mor resident Ankita Sinha, who is busy in shopping for her brother Amitesh Sinha’s wedding scheduled in February, said her family would be purchasing gold for the bride and the groom according to the tradition. “We have already done half the gold shopping. At the maximum, we can go for 18 caret gold as gift for our relatives to suit our budget, but we will not be compromising on gold quality for the bride and the groom,” Ankita said.

Bullion traders said the reason for surging gold price over the past few days was tension between US and Iran. City-based economist DM Diwakar also cited tension in the Middle East as the reason behind rise in gold prices at present. “People in India are investing more in gold than in share market because of negative growth rate; hence, the demand for the yellow metal is also leading to increase in its price. Such trend has become more visible after demonetisation. Weak rupee has also made gold expensive at present,” he said.

Title: Rupee depreciation to help IT cos in a seasonally weak quarter
Content: Chennai: A seasonally soft quarter for Information Technology (IT) companies with increased shut-down days is likely to see further weakness due to segment-specific challenges in Banking and Financial Services (BFS) and retail verticals. Research firms expect an average 0.5%-2% constant currency (CC) sequential revenue growth for the top-tier IT players in the period- compared to around 1.5%-3% growth they typically post in December quarters in previous years. Weak tech spends by BFS firms and volatility in discretionary spends by disruption-hit retail sector is likely to bring moderation in revenue growth for IT players during October-December, while depreciation of rupee will benefit profitability, analysts estimate. “While top-tier IT players like TCS typically register 1.5%-1.6% CC sequential growth in the third quarter (Oct-Dec), we expect them to grow revenue at around 0.6% in December 2019,” Kuldeep Koul, research analyst at ICICI Securities, told TOI.ICICI Securities expects Tech Mahindra to grow the fastest at around 3% Q-o-Q and growth to be sluggish at TCS and Infosys. Analysts at Edelweiss Securities estimate top five IT players — Infosys, Tech Mahindra, HCL, TCS and Wipro — to report revenue growth in the range of 1.6%–4.1% quarter-on-quarter in CC terms.Despite slowing revenue growth, the deprecation of the rupee against global currencies is expected to help profitability in the quarter. “INR depreciation along with cross currency tailwinds in the quarter will help margins by an average 20-25 basis points (bps) (100 basis points= 1%) for most companies in our coverage,” ICICI Securities’ Koul added. However, factors pulling down profitability, such as high on-site costs and transition costs of large deals, will continue to impact the sector. The net impact on profits will depend on company-specific utilisation rates and deal wins in the quarter, analysts said.“Margin recovery, while aided by weak INR, could be partially offset by impact of furloughs,” researchers at Edelweiss said, anticipating a 20–35 bps bump in margins on account of currency movements. Major currencies such as the GBP, Euro, and Australan Dollar all appreciated in the range of 2-6% in the Oct-Dec period, macro data shows. Industry trackers are watching for management commentary on BFSI and retail, the sizes and tenures of digital deal wins, and commentary on overall geo-political factors. “We have seen multiple deal announcements by companies during this quarter, which is a positive as far as future demand is concerned,” Koul said.Demand outlook for calendar year 2020 may feel heat from the US elections, Kawaljeet Saluja, research analyst at Kotak Institutional Equities, said in a note. “During the run-up to elections, clients could be wary of signing large outsourcing deals with offshore providers that entail significant rebadging of onsite workforce, leading to delays in deal closures,” he said.

Title: Minister honours 20 state artisans
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

PATNA: Altogether 20 artisans from across the state were honoured for their excellence in handicrafts by state industries minister Shyam Rajak on Tuesday. Madhubani painting, tikuli art, jute art, terracotta handicrafts and samples of different other forms of art and crafts were taken for the selection of winners for 2016-17.

The winners received Rs 23,000 each. “The winners of state handicrafts award for 2017-18 will get Rs 50,000 each,” Rajak said.

Congratulating city-based Upendra Maharathi Shilp Anusandhan Sansthan (UMSAS) for promoting indigenous art forms of the state, the minister said, “UMSAS started handling the responsibility of handicrafts in 2014. Since then, the state has received five gold medals at the international business fair, which is organised in New Delhi every year.”

The minister also urged UMSAS to set up its counters at Patna airport. “Bihar is known for its handicrafts, especially Madhubani paintings, which have made a mark in the world. I want people from outside Bihar to understand different forms of handicrafts,” he said.

UMSAS director Ashok Kumar Sinha said the amount of talent the artisans of the state have is a source of inspiration. “They just need to support,” Sinha added.

Sita Devi, who was felicitated for her talent in handicrafts in 1984, said, “Women living in rural as well as urban areas have gradually started understanding the importance of art and culture. They are learning how to display their talents.”

Rashmi Singh, who received an award in papier-mâché, said, “I was interested in papier-mâché art since childhood. With constant support of my parents, I made a career in this field.”

Vishuddhanand Mishra, who received an award in Manjusha art, said, “My work gives me real happiness. I am very happy after receiving the award.”

Title: Students turn up in traditional ‘veshti’, ‘pavadai sattai’ on school reopening
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Students of Oxford Nursery and Primary School in Somarasampettai dressed in traditional attires

TRICHY: It wasn’t a usual day for children in Oxford Nursery and Primary School in Somarasampettai on Tuesday when schools reopened after a gap of more than 10 days.

Unlike other days, children turn up in traditional attire wearing ‘veshti’ and colourful shirts instead of the usual uniforms. While boys wore ‘veshti’, girls donned the traditional ‘pavadai sattai’ (skirt shirt) to come to the school. Teachers too came wearing the traditional attire. The school said that the objective was to make the students aware of traditional attire. A photography session was held followed by an orientation to the children on the purpose of such a celebration.

‘Veshti day’ announced by UNESCO is celebrated every year on January 6. As it was a closed holiday on Monday, we chose to celebrate it on Tuesday, said Raveena Mohanraj, correspondent of the school. We wanted to educate children on the traditional weavers of our country, she said.

S Prajan of class IV from the school found the ‘veshti’ comfortable than trousers. He wished if he could come to school wearing ‘veshti’ on a daily-basis. “I didn’t know about the weavers and wish to visit them to see how ‘veshtis’are made,” said Prajan.

S Santosh Kumar from class III said that he found it a bit time consuming to wear ‘veshti’and a bit uncomfortable in the beginning, but became used to it after wearing it through the day.

Block education officer K Marudhanayagam said that many of the schools had planned such events but postponed it due to distribution of books on the reopening day. He said that he will ask other schools to also sensitize children on the traditional attire.

Title: Malik’s speech hollow on fin crisis, says Digambar Kamat
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

PORVORIM: In a critical reaction, leader of opposition Digambar Kamat said the governor’s speech in the House on Tuesday had no mention about how the state will come out from the financial crisis it is in.

Kamat told reporters that listening to the governor it appeared that there was no actual reality in his speech.

The state is going through a financial crisis, but there is no mention of it in the speech, he said. “We always say that the state is going through a financial crisis. Actually it appears that there is a financial emergency,” Kamat said.

To further highlight the state’s financial condition, Kamat said that the governor spoke about how much money was disbursed through the Laadli Laxmi scheme when girls who wed in 2018 and 2019 were yet to receive the money. “We are in 2020 and this is the financial position of the state,” he said.

The governor in his speech said that 65,724 beneficiaries have availed of the Laadli Laxmi. Under the social welfare scheme the government gives the newly married girl Rs 1 lakh.

He poked holes in the governor’s statement that the safety and security of tourists, women and children were the topmost priority of his government, and said that the recent incident wherein an impersonator met Goa ministers saying he was a UP minister pointed to the contrary.

“When such incident takes place there is always a question in the mind about the security,” he said.

Reacting to the governor saying that the government was committed to restarting mining in the second half of the year, Kamat said, “We have mentioned in the assembly to bring in an amendment to the MMRD Act or bring in an ordinance to restart mining, but what we are hearing is just assurances. There is no progress in the mining issue.”

Title: Book fair to display Keeladi artefacts, sand sculpture
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Stalls being installed at YMCA ground, Nandanam

CHENNAI: Sangam-era artefacts excavated at Keeladi and Odisha’s famed sand sculptures will greet visitors at the 43rd Chennai Book Fair to be held at YMCA ground in Nandanam from January 9 to 21.

The Booksellers and Publishers’ Association of South India (BAPASI), with help from the archaeology department, has built a special auditorium for visitors to view the artefacts excavated from Keeladi in Sivaganga. “We have an exhibition at Madurai displaying Keeladi artefacts. A major collection of artefacts from that exhibition will be displayed at the bookfair,” said T Udhayachandran, commissioner of archaeology, Tamil Nadu . Replicas of some of the critical items which cannot be transported will be made.

“To see the artefacts one has to travel to Madurai. We are giving an opportunity to Chennaiites at the book fair to witness the Sangam-era artefacts,” he said.

The auditorium will also have virtual reality gears where visitors will get a feel of walking through the excavation site. Sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik will create a sand sculpture of Tamil saint-poet Thiruvalluvar at the entrance of the venue.

Two crore books will be on display at the fair. There will be more than 750 stalls.

“Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami would inaugurate the fair on January 9,” said R S Shanmugam, president of BAPASI. Publishers and booksellers have announced a 10% discount for all books at the fair.

“We have distributed five lakh free tickets to schools in and around Chennai to attract children to the fair. Last year, we had more than 20 lakh visitors and we expect more than 40 lakh visitors this year,” said BAPASI secretary S K Murugan.

The book fair will also have an 800sqft resting area.

“To connect writers, readers and publishers, BAPASI will hold an event called ‘Eluthalar Mutram’ (Writers Courtyard) where famous writers will introduce their books,” he said.

There will be oratory, drawing and quiz competitions for students. Short films and documentaries having social themes will be screened in an auditorium arranged separately for the purpose. Online tickets, wheel chairs for differently abled and mobile ATMs will also be made available. The fair will be open from 3pm to 9pm on weekdays and 11am to 9pm on holidays.

Title: Tata Capital CFO quits as co looks to raise funds
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Puneet Sharma (File photo)

MUMBAI: Tata Capital ’s CFO Puneet Sharma has resigned after more than a decade-long stint with the financial services arm of the Tata Group. The resignation comes around the time when the company’s housing finance unit is raising Rs 2,000 crore through non-convertible debentures (NCDs).

Tata Capital has seen a string of exits from its management team in recent times and Sharma, who was present at the NCD launch press conference of Tata Capital Housing Finance on Monday, is the latest one to put in his papers. In August 2018, Govind Sankaranarayanan resigned from the COO position at Tata Capital.

Sharma could not be reached for a comment. He joined Tata Capital in 2008 after working with Citibank, Boston Consulting and KPMG India. Tata Capital declined to comment on the report.

Sources attributed the exits to differences of opinion with MD and CEO Rajiv Sabharwal, who joined Tata Capital in January 2018 from ICICI Bank. Variation in approach and the style of functioning are among the other, the sources added.

Sabharwal, said the sources, has hired at least a dozen people from the organizations where he had worked, before moving to Tata Capital. This, they said, has not gone down well with long-timers in the system. Some of the recent recruits to Tata Capital’s leadership team include Kusal Roy, MD of Tata Capital Financial Services who was hired from ICICI Bank in March 2018, and Anil Kaul, MD of Tata Capital Housing Finance who too was tapped from ICICI Bank in July 2018.

Tata Capital Housing Finance’s Rs 2,000-crore NCD issue will close on January 17. This is the company’s first public NCD offering through which it plans to raise at least 40% of the total amount from retail investors. On Tuesday, the opening day, it raised Rs 1,940 crore.

Title: Delhi: On election officer’s orders, corporations start removing political hoardings
Content:
All unauthorised political advertisements in public spaces like railway stations, bus stands, airport, bridges... Read More

NEW DELHI: Following a directive from the chief electoral officer of Delhi, the three municipal corporations have removed 1.7 lakh political posters, banners and public hoardings put up illegally to enforce the model code of conduct for the Delhi assembly elections.In a circular issued to the corporations on Monday, the CEO clarified that no defacement of government or private property would be allowed. All unauthorised political advertisements in public spaces like railway stations, bus stands, airport, bridges, government buses, electric or telephone poles, and municipal buildings will have to be removed within 48 hours of the announcement of the election schedule on Monday, the circular stated.In case of government properties or buildings, all such writings should be removed within 24 hours of the announcement and no misuse of official vehicle will also be allowed. Delhi will vote on February 8 and the results will be out on February 11.Both north and south municipal corporations started sending their teams to different areas from Tuesday, a civic official said. “On Tuesday, we removed 35,570 hoardings, banners, boards and posters from various public places. The drive was intensified on Wednesday and we targeted 44,161 articles in six zones,” a north corporation official said.South Delhi Municipal Corporation has removed over 64,000 publicity materials till Wednesday from all four zones. Most of the violations were found in the South zone, from where 23,069 articles were removed, said an official.East Delhi Municipal Corporation removed over 30,000 illegal posters on Wednesday and the drive will continue.

Title: JNU violence: Viral video fact check leaves ABVP red-faced
Content:
The video showing a man in a red jacket, identified as Sharvender Kumar, beating a person was widely circulate... Read More

Video bears witness to #JNU VC @mamidala90's statement that those opposing registration for Winter session of #JNU… https://t.co/OPVcfI4nbJ — Prasar Bharati News Services (@PBNS_India) 1578299214000

NEW DELHI: A video claiming the violence in Jawaharlal Nehru University on Sunday was triggered by leftist groups attacking ABVP activists proved hugely embarrassing for the RSS-affiliated student organisation on Monday when a fact check revealed that the attacker was actually an ABVP member. The video had retweeted by M Jagadesh Kumar, JNU vice-chancellor, saying the “video bears witness to #JNUVC@mamidala90’s statement that those opposing the registration for winter session of #JNU are behind violence to scuttle the academic process of varsity” (sic).The video showing a man in a red jacket beating another wearing green was widely circulated on social media. It was first posted on Twitter by a journalist stating, “This triggered the clashes in #JNU campus. Students associated with Left parties bashed up #ABVP members when they were facilitating admission process. Students from #Left parties wanted to cancel admission process in #JNU.”The video went viral with Prasar Bharati News Services tweeting it, followed by BJP functionaries like Chetan Bragta, IT head and convenor of Himachal BJP, national IT cell head Amit Malviya and BJP spokesperson Suresh Nakhua.However, Altnews, which assesses fake news, disclosed on Monday, “The man in the red jacket is ABVP member Sharvender Kumar, a third-year PhD student at Centre for West Asian Studies, School of International Studies in JNU. His identity was confirmed to Alt News by four JNU students, two of whom are from SIS.” Apparently, Kumar was thrashing fellow SIS student Vivek Pandey on the school lawns.TOI asked Durgesh Kumar, president of JNU’s ABVP unit, whether Sharvender was an outfit member. Durgesh Kumar protested that “no ABVP member has indulged in any violence” but when it was pointed out that Sharvender could be seen in the company of ABVP activists wearing the outfit’s name card, he accepted that he was indeed a member of the RSS-linked student group and his junior in West Asian Studies. “Why he is seen beating up someone, I don’t know,” the unit president claimed.VC M Jagadesh Kumar, when asked why he had retweeted a video with the false accusation, said, “I also retweet from the MHRD handle and these are government-run twitter handles." The VC added that investigation would help identify those involved in Sunday’s violence.In Video: Video fact check leaves ABVP red-faced as JNU attackers identified as RSS-affiliate’s members

Title: Sun Pharma eyes China, Japan markets
