Title: Political parties gear up for electoral semis in Bihar
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Rajiv Ranjan Singh

PATNA: The political parties in Bihar are set to play an electoral semi-finals in April-May before the assembly elections due later this year. Altogether 29 seats in Bihar legislative council will fall vacant by May and elections will be held for altogether 17 seats as 12 will be nominated by the governor for the 75-member Upper House.

Two seats from the governor quota are already vacant after the resignation of former minister Pashupati Kumar Paras and JD(U) leader Rajiv Ranjan Singh alias Lalan Singh in May last year following their election to the Lok Sabha from Hajipur and Munger, respectively.

Seventeen seats will fall vacant on May 6 while the rest 10 on May 23. Of the 17 members to be elected through biennial poll, four will come from the graduates’ constituency, another four from the teachers’ constituency and the rest nine from the Vidhan Sabha constituency.

The four graduates’ constituencies where biennial polls will be necessitated probably in April are Patna, Tirhut, Darbhanga and Kosi. These seats will fall vacant as the term of Neeraj Kumar (JDU), Devesh Chandra Thakur (Independent), Dilip Kumar Choudhary (JDU) and N K Yadav (BJP) will expire on May 6.

Similarly, four seats from teachers’ constituencies to fall vacant are Patna, Tirhut, Darbhanga, and Saran as the term of Nawal Kishor Yadav (BJP), Sanjay Kumar Singh (CPI), Madan Mohan Jha (Congress) and Kedar Nath Pandey (CPI) will expire on May 6.

Out of the nine members from Vidhan Sabha constituency retiring on May 6, six are from JD(U) and three belong to its ally BJP. They are Council’s acting chairperson Haroon Rashid, Ashok Kumar Choudhary, Prashant Kumar Shahi, Satish Kumar, Sonelal Mehta, Hira Prasad Bind from JD(U) and Krishna Kumar Singh, Sanjay Prakash and Radha Mohan Sharma from BJP.

Moreover, another 10 members, who were nominated by the governor six years back and completing their term on May 23 are Ram Lakhan Ram ‘Raman’, Vijay Kumar Mishra, Rana Gangeshwar Singh, Javed Iqbal Ansari, Shiv Prasann Yadav, JD(U)’s chief whip Sanjay Kumar Singh alias Gandhiji, Ram Bachan Roy, Lallan Kumar Sarraf, Ranbir Nandan and Ram Chandra Bharti.

As the election for 17 seats are likely to be held in April, prospective candidates have started lobbying in their respective parties. Those seeking nomination against 12 seats from the governor quota have also started lobbying with the top leaders of the ruling JD(U), BJP and LJP.

“The 12 seats may be distributed among the JD(U), BJP and the LJP,” a senior BJP leader said.

“Our party’s top leaders will decide as to who will get nomination from the governor’s quota. It is my second term in the council. I got enough honour and opportunity from my party. I am a dedicated soldier of JD(U) and will do whatever the party leaders ask me to do,” JD(U) chief whip Sanjay Kumar Singh told TOI on Tuesday.

Though the Election Commission is yet to announce the schedule for the biennial polls in the graduates’ and teachers’ constituencies, prospective candidates have already begun hectic campaigning in their respective constituencies.

State's information and public relations minister Neeraj Kumar, who was elected from Patna graduates’ constituency last time, have already started holding public meetings in his area in the hope of getting the party’s symbol. “In the recent months, I held more than 100 meetings in different villages and block level towns to seek vote in favour of the JD(U). Though the party has so far not declared its candidate for the Patna graduate seat, I have given a slogan to vote for JD(U) against the ‘politics of dynasty’ and ‘politics of amassing illegal assets’,” Neeraj told TOI on Tuesday.

Title: Bihar: Auto, bus and truck drivers to join trade unions’ strike on Wednesday
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Shop closed during bandh in Patna (File Photo)

PATNA: The student wings of political parties, university and aviation forums among others will participate in the All-India strike called by the trade unions on Wednesday against the Centre’s ‘anti-people’ policies.

The trade unions to join the strike include INTUC, AITUC, HMS, CITU, AIUTUC, TUCC, SEWA, AICCTU, LPF and UTUC. Congress party has supported the strike.

More than 20 lakh autorickshaw, bus and truck drivers and khalasis, masons and petrol pump workers will also participate in the strike. Bihar State Auto Chalak Sangh’s general secretary Raj Kumar Jha said around 25 lakh workers under All India Transport Workers Federation are expected to join above 20 lakh of them in the strike. “No autorickshaws, buses and e-rickshaws will ply on the road on Wednesday,” he said.

Bihar Truck Owner’s Association’s president Bhanu Shekhar Prasad said all the truck drivers will take part in the demonstration.

The trade unions in Bihar organized street corner meetings and door-to-door campaign to garner support for the strike. CITU leader Ganesh Shankar Singh said all trade organizations will join the strike. “The workers in several sectors are facing problems due to anti-worker policies of central government. Our protest is over increasing unemployment, economic slowdown, privatization of public sectors and closure of several companies,” he said.

Bihar Congress’s president Madan Mohan Jha has instructed all district units of the party to actively participate in the strike. “People are fed up with unemployment, inflation and corruption and central government’s policies. We support the nationwide strike called by the trade unions,” he said.

Altogether 13 student and youth wings of different political parties have also announced their support to the strike. The decision was taken during a joint press conference organized by AISF, AISA, SFI, NSUI, Chhatra RLSP, Chhatra VIP, PDSF, Bhim Army, JAP, The Great Bhim Army, AIDSO and DSO among others at Adalatganj on Tuesday. They will protest against CAA- NRC-NPR issues as well as to show their solidarity with students of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) and Jamia Millia Islamia. AISF’s state secretary Sushil Kumar said all student organizations condemned the attack on JNU and JMU students. “A proposal was sent to PU VC to reschedule the exams scheduled on January 8 as we will stage protest from the university gate,” he said.

Joint Forum of Unions and Associations of Airport Authority India (AAI), Patna will also hold demonstration at the city airport. The association’s secretary, Aklesh Kumar Singh, told this newspaper that flight operations would remain unaffected during the strike. “The strike has been called against the Centre’s decision to develop six airports on public-private-partnership mode,” he said.

All India Kisan Sangharsh Coordination Committee, an umbrella platform for over 100 farmer organizations, has called for a ‘Grameen Bandh’. Over 50,000 farmers will join the protest across Bihar. All India Kisan Sabha general secretary Ashok Singh said no farmer will supply vegetables or dairy products in the market on January 8.

Title: Patna: Republic Day Parade rehearsal to begin from Friday
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Full dress rehearsal of Republic Day parade at Gandhi Maidan in Patna (File Photo)

PATNA: Altogether 17 departments and agencies of the state government will take part in the Republic Day parade to be held at Gandhi Maidan on January 26.

The participants have selected different themes for their tableaux, which will be prepared by local artists near the S K Memorial Hall. The district administration has put up waterproof shades for the purpose and instructed the departments to complete the work within the stipulated time.

“The deadline for finishing the tableaux is January 24. The list of the participants has not been finalised yet, but altogether 17 departments and agencies of the government have informed us about their themes,” Patna district magistrate (DM) Kumar Ravi told this newspaper on Tuesday.

Rehearsal for the R-Day parade will begin from January 10 and the final rehearsal will be done on January 24. “As many as 16 contingents, including Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF), Central Industrial Security Force (CISF), Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB), National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), State Disaster Response Force (SDRF), National Cadet Corps (NCC), Bihar Military Police (BMP), Bihar police and home guard jawans, will participate in the parade,” Ravi said.

The themes chosen by different departments are rainwater harvesting (urban development and housing department), prohibition (excise and prohibition department), Mukhyamantri Gram Parivahan Yojana (transport department), weather-friendly farming programme (agriculture department), Buddhist Circuit (tourism department), Jal-Jivan-Hariyali (information and public relations department), climate change and tree plantation (environment, forest and climate change department), road safety (road construction department), and Ganga Emergence Scheme (water resources department). The panchayati raj department is yet to decide its theme.

Government agencies that will display their tableaux include the State Health Society (redevelopment of Patna Medical College and Hospital), Bihar Education Project Council (world of books), Women Development Corporation (violence against women), State Election Commission (election literacy), Bihar Renewable Energy Development Agency (Niche Machli Upar Bijli), Jeevika (financial sustenance), and Upendra Maharathi Shilp Anusansadhan Sansthan (Neera production).

State Health Society’s official, Beauty Kumari, said, “We will promote the PMCH, which will be redeveloped as the world’s largest hospital with 5,462 beds.”

Title: No one arrested in 4 loot cases in Patna
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Police failed to make any breakthrough in all four loot cases in Patna on Sunday and Monday.

While a dairy firm employee was robbed of Rs2.5 lakh on Annie Besant Road under Pirbahore police station area on Monday afternoon, criminals looted Rs3.15 lakh from a paper firm staff near DP Complex under Kadamkuan police station area on Sunday. In a separate incident, two bike-borne criminals looted Rs40,000 from a petrol station in Digha area of the city while four armed criminals on two bikes looted Rs2.5 lakh from a cooking gas supply agency near Chiraura village under Naubatpur police station area the same evening.

Pirbahore police station SHO Rizwan Ahmed Khan on Tuesday said none of the criminals involved in the loot incident were identified yet. He said investigation was going on in the case.

In the Kadamkuan case, police said no one had been arrested even two days after the incident.

Naubatpur police station SHO Samrat Deepak Kumar also said no one was identified in the gas agency loot case. “Investigation is going on to ascertain their identities,” he said.

Though Digha police station SHO Manoj Kumar Singh said the criminals involved in the petrol pump loot were identified, but police could not arrest them so far. “Though two criminals on a bike had entered the pump premises and looted money, but in course of investigation, it surfaced that their two more associates on another bike were waiting outside as a backup. The criminals live together in Danapur locality. They are also involved in other loot cases in neighbouring police station areas,” he said.

Title: Trendy jewellery in vogue among soon-to-be brides
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Women selecting gold jewellery for marriage ceremony at a shop in Patna

PATNA: With the prices of gold going up sharply, Patnaites are left with no choice but to buy other metals and stones that are less expensive.

According to some city jewellers, platinum is in vogue among young people as they consider it classy.

“There is not much difference in the prices of gold and platinum jewellery. Hence, young couples prefer platinum rings, bracelets and love bands of similar designs. They also buy Turkish jewellery because it is lighter and cheaper,” Saket Keshri, the owner of a jewellery shop in Hathua Market, told this newspaper on Tuesday.

Middle-aged and elderly people, however, usually purchase gold jewellery, despite its high rate, because they consider it a “long-term investment”. The manager of a jewellery store on Boring Road, Pawan Kumar, pointed out, “Gold, according to many, symbolizes tradition. So, whether it is expensive or cheap, they will buy it.”

Pawan added, “The young generation has a completely different taste when it comes to buying jewellery. They go for everything that is in trend — from rubies to emeralds and sapphires.”

Soon-to-be bride, Priya Kumar , is planning to buy a Turkish necklace set for her wedding. The Saguna Mor resident said, “My mother wanted me to wear a heavy gold set on my wedding day, but I have decided to purchase a Turkish set as it is trendy.”

Another bride-to-be, Poornima Verma, who will tie the knot in February, is a huge fan of platinum and sapphire. “Platinum jewellery looks elegant and classy. That is what I am planning to buy,” she said.

Title: Vigilance bureau seized record Rs 3 crore last year
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

PATNA: The vigilance investigation bureau (VIB) recovered Rs 3 crore , including Rs 2.53 crore during search operations in the offices and the residential premises of the corrupt public servants and individuals and Rs 47.81 lakh in altogether 41 trap cases in 2019. The 2018 figures stood at Rs78 lakh only, including Rs 37.91 lakh during the search operations and Rs 40 lakh in 53 trap cases across the state.

ADG (vigilance) Sunil Kumar Jha said the recovery of Rs3 crore in 2019 was perhaps the highest in the country in a particular year so far the drive against corruption by any state’s anti-corruption cell is concerned. The VIB is the anti-corruption wing of the state government.

“The cash recovered during the operations in Bihar was deposited in the bank account of the bureau after providing relevant information to the special vigilance courts,” Sunil said.

The bureau officials seized Rs47.81 lakh in cash in 41 trap cases and arrested 45 persons on graft charges in 2019. In 2018, only a sum of Rs37.91 lakh was recovered during the search operations while Rs40 lakh was seized in altogether 53 trap cases. In all, 60 persons were booked on graft charges in 2018.

According to the Prevention of Corruption Act 2018, giving a bribe to any serving public servant is an offence with up to seven years’ imprisonment or fine or both. Authoritative sources said the two executive engineers — Suresh Prasad Singh and Shashi Bhushan Kumar — posted with road construction department were nabbed by the bureau’s trap teams, which recovered Rs14 lakh and Rs16 lakh, respectively.

A senior VIB officer said the amount recovered from the possession of the two executive engineers was the highest ever cash seized by the trap teams from any public servant in recent times. The bureau also registered six disproportionate assets (DA) cases against corrupt government employees.

Sources said a DA case of Rs5.16 crore was lodged against executive engineer Suresh Prasad Singh and his wife Shanti Singh following the recovery of Rs2.36 crore cash from his West Patel Nagar house in Patna on June 8, 2019. Singh is still languishing in the Beur central jail.

Surprisingly, seven cases of abuse of official position were reported to the bureau in 2019. The most important among them was related to Ram Kishore Singh, a member of the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC), who with an accomplice Parmeswar Rai had allegedly demanded the bribe in lieu of helping a candidate in the interview.

Moreover, immovable property worth Rs11.64 crore belonging to seven corrupt officials was confiscated under the provisions of Bihar Special Courts Rule 2009 in 2019. In addition, altogether 465 complaints were disposed of by the investigating officers last year.

Title: Anna Nagar Tower Park to get gym for women, yoga centre
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Residents in and around the Anna Nagar Tower Park area will soon get a yoga centre and a gym for women.

Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) has floated tenders to construct a gym for women as well as a completely covered yoga centre at the cost of Rs 11.8 lakh. This falls in ward 100 of zone 8. The funds have been made available from the local Member of Legislative Assembly (MLA)’s funds for development of his constituency.

Across the city and extended areas, there are many parks where gym equipment has been provided by the GCC. These are popular among citizens who either don’t have the time, inclination or financial capability to pay fees for a gym in the city. Usually the equipment provided in such parks include exercise cycle and adjustable bench press among others.

“There has been a huge demand from nearby residents to install gym equipment in the park,” said a senior GCC official in Anna Nagar zone.

The gym would be constructed in a way where it would be open at the top but covered on the sides, with adequate green cover for women patrons. The gym would have at least six equipment, the official said.

As for the yoga centre, the official said there had been requests to construct it in a manner so that it could be used during monsoon as well. “We will have a GI sheet roofing,” he said.

Officials said they have many proposals for adding amenities in parks as there is a huge rush between 8am and 11am and after 4pm of local residents.

“However, we have been unable to execute the work due to shortage of funds,” the official said.

Title: Chennai: ‘Probe report into graft complaint against Velumani ready’
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

S P Velumani

CHENNAI: The preliminary inquiry into corruption complaints against local administration minister S P Velumani is over and a report has been submitted too, government informed the Madras high court on Tuesday.

Recording the submissions, a division bench of Justice M Sathyanarayanan and Justice R Hemalatha directed the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) to produce the preliminary inquiry report along with the case files by January 23.

The matter relates to the corruption complaints lodged with DVAC by the DMK and anti-graft organisation Arappor Iyakkam, alleging illegalities in awarding tenders of corporations. On Tuesday, state public prosecutor A Natarajan told the bench that the inquiry had been completed and a report submitted to the director of DVAC.

Earlier, senior advocate NR Elango, representing the DMK, submitted that the Prevention of Corruption Act does not mandate preliminary inquiry at all. However, the agency is claiming to be conducting the inquiry as per the DVAC manual. “The manual is nothing but various circulars issued by the state or the DVAC setting guidelines to conduct inquiries. But in no way the manual can be placed above the provisions of the CrPC,” Elango said.

This apart, as per the amendment made to the PC Act, only governor can order sanction to commence inquiry against a public servant. But in the present case, DVAC has obtained the sanction from the chief secretary, he added.

Arguing for Arappor Iyakkam, advocate V Suresh submitted that in view of involvement of a senior minister like Velumani the petitioner has no trust that any of the wings of the state government would conduct a fair probe. Pointing out that as per the PC Act the DVAC is bound to complete the preliminary inquiry within 4 months, Suresh said the state gave its concurrence for the probe on January 8, 2019 and the DVAC commenced it on January 21, 2019. It been almost a year but still they claim not to have completed the inquiry. DVAC cannot take cover under the preliminary inquiry, he added.

Title: Delhi: On election officer’s orders, corporations start removing political hoardings
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

All unauthorised political advertisements in public spaces like railway stations, bus stands, airport, bridges... Read More

NEW DELHI: Following a directive from the chief electoral officer of Delhi, the three municipal corporations have removed 1.7 lakh political posters, banners and public hoardings put up illegally to enforce the model code of conduct for the Delhi assembly elections.

In a circular issued to the corporations on Monday, the CEO clarified that no defacement of government or private property would be allowed. All unauthorised political advertisements in public spaces like railway stations, bus stands, airport, bridges, government buses, electric or telephone poles, and municipal buildings will have to be removed within 48 hours of the announcement of the election schedule on Monday, the circular stated.

In case of government properties or buildings, all such writings should be removed within 24 hours of the announcement and no misuse of official vehicle will also be allowed. Delhi will vote on February 8 and the results will be out on February 11.

Both north and south municipal corporations started sending their teams to different areas from Tuesday, a civic official said. “On Tuesday, we removed 35,570 hoardings, banners, boards and posters from various public places. The drive was intensified on Wednesday and we targeted 44,161 articles in six zones,” a north corporation official said.

South Delhi Municipal Corporation has removed over 64,000 publicity materials till Wednesday from all four zones. Most of the violations were found in the South zone, from where 23,069 articles were removed, said an official.

East Delhi Municipal Corporation removed over 30,000 illegal posters on Wednesday and the drive will continue.

Title: Seven cops arrested after undertrial tries to shoot self inside courtroom
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Agra: Mainpuri police on Tuesday arrested seven policemen including a woman constable on charges of dereliction of duty and criminal conspiracy, a day after an accused in a triple murder case shot and injured himself with a countrymade pistol inside a local court room. The weapon was allegedly sneaked into the courtroom by the wife of the accused, Manish Yadav. She has also been arrested.

The seven arrested cops were released on bail later in the evening.

The incident took place barely a month after the brazen shootout inside a courtroom in Bijnor in which an alleged history-sheeter was shot while he was appearing in a murder case, by the son of a slain BSP leader. The incident has set the alarm bells ringing over security arrangements in UP’s district courts.

Talking to TOI, Mainpuri SP Ajay Kumar said that 10 policemen, including the seven arrested cops, had been suspended in connection with the incident. He said that the arrested cops were remanded to judicial custody today. “They are prima facie responsible for the incident as they all were directly involved in escorting and frisking of under trials, who had to appear before the additional district judge Tarun Kumar Singh’s court on Monday and remaining three were supervisory officers,” said the SP.

The arrested cops are constable Yogendra Chaudhary, who was on duty at Sadar lock up, from where the under trial had to come to the court room, constable Pradeep Raja, who had to escort him to the court, and five others, head constable Ramakant Upadhyaya, constable Satyaveer Singh, head constable LIU Vijay singh, constable LIU Dileep Kumar and woman constable Kusum Chahar, who were involved in checking and frisking at the main gate of the court.

The cops have been booked under Section 211 (false charge of offence made with intent to injure), 420 (cheating), and 120 B (criminal conspiracy) of IPC, said additional SP OP Singh. Beside these seven, inspector Mukesh Malik, in charge of court security, inspector Vijay Kumar Gautam and sub-inspector Ajay Pratap Singh, who were on duty at Sadar police station, have been suspended.

Manish’s maternal uncle, Vinod, who had got the weapon and bullets, however, managed to flee from the spot. The accused’s wife Seema had reportedly concealed the weapon inside her dress and had handed it over to her husband while he was entering the courtroom.

The court clerk, Devendra Gaur, who filed a complaint in the case, stated in the FIR that the incident took place around 3 pm on Monday, when three accused in the case, including Manish, were present inside the witness box. According to information, the judge was inside the court’s chamber that time.

The SP said that earlier Manish claimed that his brother-in-law Prince was behind the attack on him but preliminary inquiryrevealed that the latter was not even present in the court when the incident took place. Manish’s wife Seema was arrested by police from her parental house in Manikpur village on Monday night and she revealed the whole story behind this.

According to the SP, during interrogation, Manish told police that he had planned to frame his brother-in-law Prince in the case in an attempt to build pressure on his sister Rachna, who is the prime witness in the triple murder case, on advice of his lawyer. Police is inquiring about his claims, said the SP.

According to police, the accused Manish, in connivance with Kallu and Jitendra, had on October 9, 2012 shot dead his father Sukhram, stepmother Sushma Devi and brother Abhishek over a property dispute under Karhal police station area of the district. Manish along with Kallu and Jitendra were produced in the court for hearing.

Manish was booked by Kotwali police on Monday under various sections of the IPC along with 3/25/26 Arms Act. He was first taken to a district hospital for treatment and later referred to Saifai medical university hospital. His left foot got injured as bullet brushed past the calf muscles, said police.

Title: Nagpur: Rs 465 crore tender floated for redevelopment of railway station
Content:
The Indian Railways Station Development Corporation Limited (IRSDCL), which has been entrusted with redevelopi... Read More

IRSDCL floated tenders for redevelopment of Nagpur station at a cost of Rs465 crore

NAGPUR: The Indian Railways Station Development Corporation Limited ( IRSDCL ), which has been entrusted with redeveloping 600 stations across the country, has floated tenders for redevelopment of Nagpur station at a cost of Rs465 crore.“Applications have been invited from private parties for request for qualification (RFQ). IRSDCL intends to pre-qualify and shortlist suitable bidders eligible for participation in the bid stage for awarding the project through an open competitive process. The last date to receive bids is February 6,” said IRSDCL officials.Of the Rs465 crore indicative project cost, Rs361.50 crore will be towards construction. Of the total land area of over 5.50 lakh sq m, built up area for commercial monetization will 20 lakh sq ft. Lease rights to the end users will be up to 99 years.The concessionaire shall, in consideration of its investment and services, be entitled to levy and collect a pre-determined user fee for specified station facilities, recover charges for use of specified spaces and services within the station, and undertake development and commercial exploitation of station estate in accordance with the provisions of the concession agreement.“If all goes well by year-end final contract will be awarded and work will start early next year. The broad scope of the work involves developing the station within three years from the effective date, and the commercial development within eight years of signing the agreement,” they said.The developer will design and develop infrastructure by dismantling existing structures on the land forming part of the station. This shall also integrate all public transport modes such as city bus, state regional bus service, metro rail, railways and intermediate public transport modes such as auto-rickshaw and taxis.The project envisages provision of central concourse as passenger departure and holding area, providing seamless interconnectivity to railway platforms, proposed metro, parking zones etc. The plan at request for qualification (RFQ) stage has been prepared by French architect ENIA.Development of facilities to handle over 2.20 lakh passengers, retail zones, parking of over 114 four-wheelers and 1,000 two-wheelers, 24 lifts and 16 escalators to ease passenger movement are some of the features of the station redevelopment.“This is the best opportunity to work with the railways. We are hopeful to get some local party and if not, there are outsiders who have shown keen interest in Nagpur. Developers can also form a consortium to bid for the project. The conditions are very transparent and IRSDCL will help get all the sanctions,” said officials.

Title: Mining in second half of year: Governor Satya Pal Malik
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

PORVORIM: Governor Satya Pal Malik on Tuesday said that the Pramod Sawant-led government would do all it can to resume mining operations in the state in the second half of the year and to protect Goa’s interests in the Mhadei water diversion issue.

The governor said that the mining industry is a major revenue and employment generator for the state and that the “government is very optimistic about resuming mining operations in Goa during the ensuing season thereby rejuvenating state’s economy and lives of citizens”.

“My government has left no stone unturned to explore all possible ways and means of resumption of mining in Goa,” Malik said in his customary speech before the state assembly on the opening day of the year’s first session.

The governor said that the BJP-led state government was conscious of the public concerns over the Mhadei water diversion issue and would do all it can to protect Goa’s interests.

Malik began his speech by highlighting the contribution made by former chief minister Manohar Parrikar . He then lauded the role of security agencies, especially Goa police, in reducing crime and giving priority to the safety and security of tourists, women and children.

In his hour-long speech, Malik stressed on mining and Mhadei issues, which also saw a united opposition protesting in the House after the speaker refused to allow a discussion on the water diversion issue.

The Goa government has deliberated both issues with several Union ministers on numerous occasions and even submitted four representations to try and garner support for the resumption of mining operations.

The state government has suggested that amendments to the Goa, Daman and Diu Mining Concessions (Abolition and Declaration as Mining Leases) Act, 1987, wherein its implementation is sought to be prospective in nature, could help restart mining, Malik said.

Moving on to the Mhadei issue, Malik — who even met and raised the issue with Prime Minister Narendra Modi — attempted to quell allegations by the opposition that the Goa government has not shown urgency in resolving the concerns.

“My government is conscious about the Mhadei issue, which affects every Goan. Efforts of my government are to prevent water diversion outside the river basin,” Malik said.

The Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal was appointed in November 2010 and it gave its award on August 14, 2018.

Goa has requested for a clarification from the tribunal under Section 5(3) of the Interstate River Water Disputes Act, 1956. Goa has also filed a Special Leave Petition in the Supreme Court praying for review of the tribunal award besides filing necessary contempt proceedings before the Supreme Court.

Title: Madurai: Polling official cast vote, alleges plea in high court
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Madras High Court

MADURAI: Madras high court has directed the state government to find out who were the two people who cast their votes in ward 6 of Mayakulam village panchayat in Ramanathapuram district where villagers claimed they had boycotted the election.

The court was hearing an impleading petition which sought to conduct re-polling in wards 4 and 6 of the village panchayat. In his petition, R Balachandar sought his inclusion as a party in a case filed by L Murugavel seeking repolling for wards 4 and 6 (polling booth 100) in Mayakulam village panchayat of Keelakarai taluk. The petitioner submitted that the residents of both the wards had boycotted the election held on December 27. While no votes were polled in ward 4, two votes were polled by panchayat officials in ward 6. Additional advocate general K Chellapandian submitted that since no votes were polled in ward 4, steps were being taken to conduct re-polling. He further submitted that two votes were polled in ward 6 of which one was invalid due to which re-polling would not be conducted there. He also said that the two votes were polled by the residents and they were not aware if they were panchayat officials.Taking note of the submissions, a division bench of Justices M Duraiswamy and T Ravindran orally asked how a panchayat official can poll an invalid vote as alleged by the petitioner. The judges directed the government to ascertain who were those two voters and adjourned the case to a further date for hearing.TNN

Title: Selection of SEC set in motion as LG-CM tussle continues
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Puducherry: The ongoing tussle between lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi and Congress government headed by chief minister V Narayanasamy over the mode of selection of state election commissioner (SEC) appears to have tilted in favour of Bedi on Tuesday with the local administration secretariat placing advertisements in newspapers inviting applications from eligible candidates for appointment of SEC to conduct the local body polls in the Union territory.

Bedi and Narayanasamy, who have been on the loggerheads over several issues, earlier declared each other’s orders related to SEC appointment as ‘null and void’.

Bedi in an order dated December 20 last year declared that the appointment of retired IAS officer T M Balakrishnan as SEC by the local administration secretariat in July last year following recommendations by the Congress government as ‘null and void’.

Bedi’s action came after the Union home ministry endorsed her views and directed the government to select the SEC through a competitive and fair process inviting applications through an all India advertisement. Bedi also passed an order directing chief secretary Ashwani Kumar to comply with the ministry’s directions and initiate efforts to select SEC.

Reacting sharply to Bedi's action Narayanasamy passed an order on January 3 declaring Bedi’s December 20 order as ‘null and void’. He directed the chief secretary not to follow Bedi’s direction. He claimed that SEC, who was nominated after the legislative assembly passed a unanimous resolution, can be removed only through legislative action. He maintained that SEC will continue his work to hold local body polls.

Amidst growing tension between the two constitutional offices, the local administration secretariat on Tuesday issued an advertisement on January 7 inviting applications from eligible candidates for the post of SEC.

Under-secretary (local administration) Giddi Balaram said people, who served under the Union or state governments for not less than 25 years with knowledge and experience in conducting elections and aged less than 65 years can apply for the lone post.

The applications must reach the director, local administration department, No 16, Suffren Street, Puducherry 605 001 before February 6. The applicants can also send soft copies to email id: dirlad.pon@nic.in.

The development is largely seen as all-out attempts by the two constitutional offices to establish their supremacy and authority in the Union territory. It may be recalled that the Madras high court bench has reserved its judgement in an appeal filed by the Union home ministry against an order of the high court that declared that the lieutenant governor cannot run a parallel government and cannot interfere with the day-to-day affairs of the elected government.

Title: Traders hold ‘Halla Bol’ rally at Ramlila Maidan
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

New Delhi: With elections due in the city, pressure groups have already started pushing their demands. Traders under the umbrella of Confederation of All India Traders organised a rally in Ramlila Maidan on Wednesday. Among other demands like halting the sealing drive and due representation in the election tickets, curbs on online e-commerce companies featured prominently.

BC Bhartia, national president of CAIT, announced at the session that a “National Halla Bol” campaign will be launched from January 15 to February 15 under the leadership of CAIT. Praveen Khandelwal, the general secretary of CAIT, said that at the call of All India Mobile Retailers Association, an associate body of the CAIT, more than 20 lakh mobile stores were closed across the country.

“Thousands of Hall Bol rallies will be held in different cities and will demand the Union and state governments to compel e-commerce companies to fall in line to comply with the policy and the law,” Khandelwal said.

The traders’ body demanded that BJP should declare a trader as a candidate for the post of chief minister of Delhi. “With more than 15 lakh traders of Delhi, their employees and families, more than 40 lakh people will support the party. The support of seven crore traders from all over the country will also strengthen it. No government in Delhi can be formed without support of the trading community as it is one of the major vote banks,” he said.

Speaking on e-commerce companies, Khandelwal alleged that they are firmly engaged in hollowing out the roots of the Indian economy by committing massive tax evasion of GST.

Title: Sun Pharma eyes China, Japan market
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Dilip Shanghvi, MD of India's most valuable drug firm Sun Pharmaceutical Industries , is now looking at new markets to fire the company's growth engine. The Gujarati businessman started his entrepreneurial journey from Kolkata with about Rs 10,000 nearly four decades ago. Today, he runs the world's fourth-largest specialty generics maker, generating revenues of over Rs 30,000 crore. Excerpts from an exclusive interview:

How is the economic slowdown affecting the sector in general, and Sun Pharma in particular?

The Indian pharma industry has registered good growth in the first half of the year, and Sun Pharma has also performed well. We have taken multiple initiatives to respond to the challenges being faced by the industry and continue to remain positive.

At a time when operating margins on generics have been impacted in the US due to increase in competition, what are the avenues identified for growth in the most lucrative market, which contributes around 35% to company's revenue?

We are continuing our focus on complex and value-added generics and expect to launch new products in areas with limited competition. At the same time, we have been making significant investments to build a portfolio of branded or specialty products for the US market.

We are currently marketing eight specialty products (Ilumya, Absorica, Bromsite, Xelpros, Yonsa, Levulan Kerastick, Odomzo & Cequa) in the US with focus on dermatology, oncology and ophthalmology. In H1FY20, our global specialty business contributed around 8% to our consolidated revenues ($2.3 billion). It is currently a small part, but we expect it to scale up over three-five years.

Markets like China and Japan have witnessed keen interest from domestic companies recently for growth. What is the company's strategy for these markets?

We expect China and Japan to become an increasingly important part of our future business. We are looking at partnering with leading pharmaceutical companies in China to introduce our specialty, differentiated and generic products. Earlier in the year, we partnered with China Medical System Holdings for both our specialty (Ilumya, Cequa) and generic products. We have also recently signed an agreement with AstraZeneca to introduce certain novel ready-to-use infusion oncology products in China. Japan is the world's second-largest pharmaceutical market and there is a lot of potential in the branded segment. We have a good basket of branded specialty products that can be introduced in Japan in future. Our subsidiary Pola Pharma's strong front-end and manufacturing capabilities give us the confidence that we will be able to serve the Japanese pharmaceutical market better in the coming years.

Are you a proponent of investing in core business, or like most conglomerates make unrelated bets?

We are very much focused on investing and strengthening our core business of pharmaceuticals.

Can you give us an update on allegations of financial irregularities and corporate governance lapses raised by a whistleblower?

At Sun, we remain committed to follow the highest levels of corporate governance. There were some perception issues that have been addressed. Our board has taken necessary steps to strengthen governance standards further. On the whistleblower query, we have provided whatever information Sebi has asked for and there is no further update.

Several companies have either incubated new ventures or acquired promising startups to give them edge. How has Sun Pharma addressed this?

Sun Pharma has picked up minority stakes of 18-20% in pharmaceutical research companies, Israeli-based Tarsius Pharma and US-based MedInstill in the past.

Title: HC: No poll in some wards in Karimnagar
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Hyderabad: Stating that when glaring irregularities pertaining to pre-election process surface, courts can hold a judicial review of the things under Article 226 of the Constitution, Justice P Naveen Rao of the high court restrained the authorities from going ahead with the election process in certain wards of Karimnagar municipal corporation and also in Nirmal, Mahabubnagar and Vanaparthi municipal bodies.

“You cannot move forward without rectifying the glaring irregularities pointed out by several petitioners from these municipal bodies,” the judge said. Counsel Mayur Reddy, who argued the case of petitioners from Karimnagar, told TOI that the judge has made it clear that the authorities cannot go forward regardless of the election schedule.

Title: Stillbirth cases double in 2019; ratio five times national, Maharashtra average
Content:
Despite being touted as the medical hub of Central India, cases of stillbirth have doubled in last one year in... Read More

NAGPUR: Despite being touted as the medical hub of Central India, cases of stillbirth have doubled in last one year in the city. The figure for stillbirth cases in 2019 is five times the national and state average.Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) registered 1,070 stillbirths (death of a baby after 24 weeks of pregnancy and before birth), of which 628 were male and 442 female in 2019. Total number of births was 53,907. Thus, ratio of stillbirth is 19.84 per 1,000 births.In 2018, the civic body had registered 58,403 births and 495 stillbirths for a ratio of 8.47 per 1,000 births.As per National Health Policy’s report, stillbirth ratio of the country as well as the state was 4 per 1,000 births in 2017. The government had set a target to bring down stillbirths to single digit by 2025.Executive member of Vidarbha Hospitals Association Dr Pinak Dande told TOI cases of stillbirth are not a reflection on city’s medical facilities. “Percentage of stillbirth might be high due to migratory labour class and poor people residing in city’s outskirts or in rural areas. It seems to be a social economic problem and not related to medical facilities,” he said.Deputy director (health) Dr Sanjay Jaiswal said the government’s schemes for registering, monitoring pregnant women, and encouraging delivery only in hospitals is being implemented in a very effective manner. “The government has made a provision for Rs5,000 in three instalments for every pregnant woman. Free delivery facility is available in NMC and government-run hospitals. Stillbirth can be avoided if a single doctor and hospital are fixed for regular check-up and delivery. Need is to visit doctor immediately in case of pain or any problem. Also, pregnant woman should go for check up in given time period by doctors, and avoid social and customary practice of delivery at maternal places if there is a lack of proper medical facilities,” he said.Each of NMC’s Urban Primary Health Centres (UPHC) covers 50,000 population in which ASHA workers have to register all pregnant women, monitor and ensure delivery at hospitals only. In case of delivery in NMC-run hospitals, all services are free and mother is given Rs600 for nutritious meals.Fortunately, city’s infant mortality rate (IMR, i.e. death of a child from day 0 to 1 year) continues to be low. In 2019, the civic body registered 335 cases of which 170 were male and 165 female, for a ratio of 6.2 per 1,000 births.In 2018, NMC recorded 305 infant mortality cases of which 115 were male and 150 female for a ratio of 5.2 per 1,000 births.As per National Health Policy, IMR of country was 33 per 1,000 births and state was 19 per 1,000 births in 2017. The central government had set target of 28 per 1,000 births for country in 2019. The state had set target IMR of 10 per 1,000 by 2030.NMC health and birth registration department under deputy municipal commissioner Ranjan Lade has improved registration of stillbirth and infant mortality in last couple of years. The department has made it mandatory for all hospitals to inform about these cases and also started to compare it with data collected from all crematoriums of the city.

Title: Nagpur: Making Maha load-shedding free is my priority
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Nitin Raut

NAGPUR: After taking over the reins of the energy portfolio in Mumbai on Tuesday, minister Nitin Raut has his task cut out. His immediate plan is to reduce transmission and distribution losses and make the state load-shedding free. The Congress MLA from Nagpur North spoke to TOI on a range of issues pertaining to the power ministry and Vidarbha in particular.

Excerpts...

Q. What are your immediate and future priorities?

A. There are many issues that need to be tackled in the power ministry. However, my immediate priority will be to make Maharashtra load-shedding free. Another area of concern is transmission and distribution losses, which need to be reduced to increase generation. There is unequal distribution of power in the state which needs to be looked at. Employment generation would be another area I would like to focus on.

Q. You seemed to have prior information about the change in your portfolio.

A. Being a senior member of the party, I was part of the decision-making process. The decision to change my portfolio was taken in my presence and with my consent. I’ve started holdings meetings with senior officials of all the three companies — Mahagenco, Mahatransco and MSEDCL. You will see good results soon.

Q. You spoke about employment generation.

A. Of course it’s a priority for Vidarbha. I am making efforts to expand Koradi thermal power plant in the next two years which will mean more jobs. I will work on reducing power tariffs for industries in Vidarbha and bring it on par with neighbouring Chhattisgarh. I am trying to explore the possibility of granting concessions to industries. I understand the concerns about pollution and will discuss with environmentalists all the issues they are concerned about. Preserving environment will be a priority. We would also promote solar power.

Q. Did the change in ministry upset you?

A. I consider myself as privileged as Bharat Ratna Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar. He was the country’s first energy minister in former prime minister Jawaharlal Nehru’s cabinet. Even before independence, he was allocated this portfolio. I am a staunch worker of the Ambedkarite movement. I’m capable of handling any responsibility entrusted to me by the party. I’m very happy to get a chance to look after this ministry.

Q. Doubts are being raised regarding the delay in portfolio allocation.

A. Please understand that we are a three-party coalition government with different ideologies and settling down will take some time. Nobody wanted fresh elections at such an early stage, neither the leaders nor the voters. We came together to keep the BJP away from power. We aim to ensure BJP-Mukt Bharat. No one should worry as our MVA government will complete its full five-year term.

Q. There were talks of many leaders getting upset over lower rung portfolios.

A. During discussions, differences emerge. This is part and parcel of politics. Issues are resolved through dialogues and discussions. The most important part is to ensure the good of the common man by working in any capacity. Ultimately, one’s hard work matters.

Q. Your government says its first priority is the farmer.

A. Even on the day of our oath-taking ceremony, CM Uddhav Thackeray had invited farmers at the venue as guests. Ours is a pro-farmer government which granted relief to them in the form of a loan waiver. We would resolve most of their grievances.

Q. Nagpur district has been given importance with five ministers.

A. That’s right. Speaker Nana Patole, Vijay Wadettiwar, Anil Deshmukh, Sunil Kedar and myself. This shows that our government is serious about developing Vidarbha which is a backward region.

Q. Are you going to be Nagpur’s guardian minister for the second time?

A. You will know about it, as and when the decision is taken by the government.

Title: Anti-CAA rally planned in city on Jan 16
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Charminar: Just three days after a massive Million March against CAA and NRC was held in the city, another protest has been planned on January 16 at Moghalpura. The rally has been planned by All India Majlis Inquilab-e-Millat. “The party has proposed a massive protest rally on January 16 from Moghalpura Kamaan to party office at Moghalpura, followed by a special prayer and the national anthem,” said Syed Taraq Quadri, president of the party.

The anti-people policy of the BJP government, he said, is nibbling away the democratic framework of the country and pushing it towards economic doom. “Unmindful of the repercussions of fomenting hatred and hegemony in the country, the government is trying to test the people using parliamentary powers as a tool to persecute them in their own country,” said Quadri.

The rally will begin at 4pm from Moghalpura Kamaan on January 16. A delegation of party leaders approached police seeking permission.

Title: ‘Crimes down by 10.4% in 2019’
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

PORVORIM: Goa governor Satya Pal Malik expressed satisfaction on Tuesday that the overall law and order situation in Goa has remained under control with a 10.4% decline in crime rate in 2019.

Malik said that the government had managed to quell crime by using technology and by better utilisation of police personnel.

“Safety and security of tourists, women and children are the topmost priority of my government. The overall law and order situation in the state has remained under control,” Malik told the House.

According to the data brought out by Malik, the crime rate has declined by 10.4% in 2019 as compared to the previous year. “At the same time crime detection rate has increased to 84% in 2019 as against 82% in 2018 due to better staffing and implementation of various preventive measures and adoption of modern technology,” he said.

Goa police crackdown on the drug trade led to the registration of 213 cases and seizure of 84kg drugs worth Rs 5.7crore, Malik said. Recently, drugs worth Rs 3 crore were seized in a single raid by Goa police, he said.

The governor also lauded the traffic sentinel scheme for being the “best example of citizen’s participation” in traffic management. He also said that Goa police has launched the e-challan system to bring in transparency and enable digital payment for traffic offences.

Title: Freedom is b’day gift: Emotional embrace with kin in home run
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Sadaf Jafar showers affection on her daughter on reaching her Gomtinagar residence

Lucknow: Her family members fixed their gaze at the mammoth gates of Lucknow district jail, waiting restlessly for hours before Sadaf Jafar finally walked out after 19 days, just a day before her 44th birthday. She was arrested on December 19 from the protest site at Parivartan Chowk in Lucknow.

Emotions ran high minutes after Jafar stepped out of jail. Her sister, Naheed, sprinted towards her and hugged her tightly. Jafar calmed her down and whispered in her ear — ‘sangharsh jari rahega’ (fight will continue). Holding hands of her sister, Naheed, and former IPS officer S R Darapuri, Jafar said, she will continue the struggle against the amended citizenship law. Worried about her kids, she then made a dash for home. Blurring the truma of her 19-day imprisonment, Jafar jumped like a kid the moment she entered the premises of her Gomtinagar residence.

She knocked at the gate which was opened by her 16-year old daughter, who got emotional at the sight of her mother and froze for a moment. Mother and daughter hugged each other even as Jafar kep consoling her by saying, ‘meri bahadur bacchi’ (my brave girl).

The domestic help spoke about how the trauma unfolded when Jafar was thrown behind bars and how her daughter cried for hours. “Are bewkoof roi kyu (why you cried),” said a concerned mother. She entered the house, holding her daughter's hand and expressing her love to every member of her family, including her pet whom she missed so much.

Title: Venkaiah Naidu to open NCT centenary fete on Friday
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

National College Trichy (NCT) prinicipal sundarraman addressing the media in trichy

TRICHY: Vice-president Venkaiah Naidu will visit National College Trichy (NCT) on January 10 to inaugurate the centenary celebrations of the institution.

The college has planned grand cultural programmes, special commemorative lectures, seminars and conferences, inter-collegiate competitions, and sports events as part of the celebrations.

Experts and great leaders across diverse fields such as science, technology, business, industry, arts, and humanities will participate in the events.

The celebrations will culminate in a grand finale by the end of the academic year.

Started as a school in 1886 during the British regime the National High School later became a college.

The college was shifted to the present campus on Dindigul Road in 1959 to accommodate more students and provide them better facilities.

The college emerged as a premier institution and has been serving the cause of higher education for the past 100 years with dedication and efficiency.

Some of the distinguished alumni of the college are R Venkataraman, former president of India and C Rangarajan, former governor of RBI.

Title: 2 die as car rams roadside tree in Thanjavur district
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

THANJAVUR: Two men died on the spot and two others suffered injuries when the car in which they were travelling rammed a roadside tree near Thirukattupalli in Thanjavur district in the early hours on Tuesday.

The deceased have been identified as Irus Marakayar, 44, of Kalima Nagar near Parangipettai in Cuddalore district and Sheik Dawood, 44, of Thirumullaivasal area near Sirkazhi in Nagapattinam district. Marakayar was running a supermarket in Cuddalore.

Jawahirudeen, 44, and Abdul Rahman sustained grievous injuries.

The four of them were friends. The accident happened around 4.30am when they were returning after visiting some places in Kerala. Marakayar, who was driving the car, lost control of the vehicle. The car rammed a roadside tree.

On being informed, the Thogur police rushed to the spot, rescued the injured and sent them to Government Medical College Hospital in Thanjavur. They registered a case.

Title: Mobile vendors demand level playing field with e-tailers
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Nagpur: As neighbourhood shop owners plan to take on e-commerce giants, mobile dealers from all over the country are expected to reach Delhi on Wednesday to attend a three-day meet organized by Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT). Around 50 mobile vendors from Nagpur, and over 200 from smaller centres in Vidarbha, may be attending the meet in which over 25,000 dealers from all over India are expected.

CAIT, an umbrella organization of traders’ associations across the country, is headed by B C Bhartia, a chartered accountant form Nagpur. The meet will include traders in other commodities too.

As the mobile vendors are planning a major show of strength, some brands have already agreed to change the terms of business to suit them. All the local associations of cell phone traders come under the All India Mobile Retailers Association (AIMRA). AIMS has received a letter from makers of Vivo phones that as a part of its 2020 strategy, the company will be offering consistent prices to both online and offline channels and also launch the same product across both channels.

The Vivo letter says, “we are in the process to streamline the equilibrium between online and offline channels. For all the existing Z and U series devices, we shall continue to sell through both channels till their end of life, which is very soon. There will be no addition in both the series during 2020,”

The traders’ main contention is against deep discounts offered at the e-commerce portals. This denies vendors a level playing field, they say. Mobile traders especially are also protesting against launching of exclusive online models of phones by the manufacturers.

“Traders from even small centres like Sakoli in Bhandara district will be reaching Delhi. The e-commerce giants have hit the conventional business hard. Offering discounts by the e-commerce companies amounts to violation of FDI policy,” said Arvinder Singh Bedi, vice-president of Nagpur Mobile Dealers Association (NMDA). Bhavesh Solanki, general secretary of AIMS, said the further strategy for the agitation will be decided after the meeting in Delhi.

CAIT had pleaded the deep discounts by e-commerce portals were violation of FDI policy in retail. Under the FDI norms, e-commerce could only provide a platform for trading and offering discounts amounts to direct selling which is against the norms. CAIT has already filed a case against e-commerce companies in Rajasthan high court.

Title: Vehicle sales fell by 16% in Ahmedabad in 2019
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Registration of vehicles in Ahmedabad city (GJ-01) registered a drop for the second consecutive year in 2019. The city recorded a drop of 16% compared to 2018 figure. While the two-wheeler segment registered a decline of 18.44% in 2019, sales of car dipped by 13.44%.Compared to 2017, car sales registered a sharp decline of 20% in 2019 in the city. Against 2.13 lakh vehicle registrations in 2017, the city registered only 1.71 lakh vehicles in 2019.According to a senior RTO official, one of the reasons for the decline in car sales is economic slowdown. “People have been finding it tough to manage their home budgets. I think, parking issues and traffic drives too have contributed to the decline,” he said. The RTO official said that the steep hike in traffic fines also affected the sales figures. “People have been going for car pool or taking radio cabs to escape hefty fines,” he added.The official said in 2019, barring October and August 2019, there was a decline in vehicle sales in the remaining 10 months in Ahmedabad city and other parts of the state. In the city, the steepest fall in registration was in September, where only 10,000 vehicles were registered, against 18,000 in 2018.However, the city, which has over 2 lakh autorickshaws, saw an addition of another 15,000 in 2019, about 2,000 more than 2018.

Title: Capital conundrum: Farmers defy cops, block NH in Krishna & Guntur
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Amaravati: Tension prevailed in Krishna and Guntur districts when groups of farmers and opposition party cadre blocked the national highway on Tuesday in protest against the proposed shifting of the state capital to Visakhapatnam.

Although police had imposed prohibitory orders, there were dharnas and blockades at many places in the two districts. The farmers demanded that the government should not shift the capital from Amaravati and recognize the sacrifices of farmers in giving land for the construction of the capital city.

Traffic on the national highway was disrupted near Mangalagiri, Gollapudi and Penamalur. Hundreds of heavy vehicles and APSRTC buses were stuck for nearly four hours during the protests.

Police kept a majority of the TDP cadre and leaders, including MPs Galla Jayadev and Kesineni Nani under house arrest as a preventive measure.

Tension prevailed at Galla Jayadev’s residence as well when the police locked the main gates to prevent him from going out. Police officials visited his residence and requested him to cooperate with them as there was no permission to stage dharnas and rasta rokos on the national highways.

The TDP activists shouted slogans against the police and demanded that they allow the MP to go out. Jayadev had an argument with cops demanding the reason for his detention.

The police detained former ministers Devineni Umamaheswara Rao, Prattipati Pullarao, former MLAs T Sravan Kumar, Alapati Rajendraprasad, Bonda Umamaheswara Rao, former MLC Babu Rajendraprasad and TDP senior leaders Panchumarthi Anuradha.

The police arrested former legislator and Guntur district TDP president GVSSR Anjaneyulu near Mangalagiri and took him to the police station. The police also arrested former ministers Nara Lokesh and Kollu Ravindra near Benz Circle when he visited the city to end the fast of local legislator Gadde Rammohan and shifted him to Thotlavallur police station.

The farmers’ protest near China Kakani of Mangalagiri mandal turned violent when the agitators attacked the vehicle of government whip Pinnelli Ramakrishna Reddy. The protestors also attacked Reddy’s security personnel causing commotion in the area.

Finance minister Buggana Rajendranth Reddy’s vehicle was caught in traffic jam while he was proceeding to Vijayawada from his bungalow near Mangalagiri. However, the police took quick measures to provide passage to the minister’s vehicle.

Meanwhile, TDP president N Chandrababu Naidu slammed the police for trying to curb peaceful agitations by farmers. He condemned the arrest of party functionaries including MPs and MLAs. He commended Palkol legislator Nimmala Ramanaidu for leading the agitation against the shifting of the capital city in West Godavari district.

Title: JAC announces Million March in Andhra on Jan 25
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

A shopkeeper displays a message against CAA and NRC on the Nampally main road in the city on Tuesday

Hyderabad: The joint action committee ( JAC ) for Million March has announced a similar protest rally in Andhra Pradesh on January 25.

Addressing the media on Tuesday afternoon, JAC convener Mushtaq Malik said: “A peaceful Million March against the NRC, NPR and CAA will be organised in Andhra Pradesh. The march will be on the lines of the one held in Hyderabad on January 4.”

A door-to-door awareness campaign against the misuse of NRC will also be carried out by the JAC, he said. Malik thanked Hyderabadis for participating in the Million March, and making it a “historic and peaceful rallies of Hyderabad”.

He said the Million March movement will continue until the government rolls back its dark and unconstitutional laws that have severely affected peace and tranquillity in the country, while shrinking its secular character.

The JAC demanded the state government and the state home ministry withdraw the cases booked in connection with the Million March.

He said, “Despite such a peaceful rally, with no disturbance to the law and order in the city, the police have booked 25 cases.”

He called upon the TRS-led state government to look into the matter and withdraw these cases.

Title: ABVP burns ‘funeral pyre’ of Left groups over JNU violence
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

AGRA: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) members on Tuesday observed a symbolic funeral of Left wing organizations, alleging that they were responsible for Sunday’s violence at Jawarharlal University in New Delhi.

The ABVP members burnt a symbolic funeral pyre of the Left organizations at Dhuliyaganj crossing here as a mark of protest.

Meanwhile, leaders of Samajwad Chatra Sabha (SCS), Samajwadi Party ’s youth wing, handed over a memorandum at the office of senior superintendent of police, demanding action against ABVP members for violation of section 144 of the CrPC.

Shivam Jain, ABVP spokesperson, said, “Our workers were brutally beaten up by Left wing goons at JNU. We are holding a protest to condemn the violence. Communists are trying to control the education institutions. We will not allow this to happen. To ensure uninterrupted teaching-learning, the Left organizations should be banned on university campuses across the country.”

Amit Pratap Yadav, SCS spokesperson, said, “Police and Agra University administration are biased in favor of ABVP. On Monday, they caused disturbance on varsity’s Paliwal park campus and on Tuesday, they staged a protest at a public place in violation of section 144. Earlier, we were detained and made to sit at the police station for the whole night for trying to protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act. We want to see Agra police taking a similar action against the ABVP.”

Superintendent of police (city) Botre Rohan Pramod said, “We have the footages of the protest organized at Dhuliyaganj on Tuesday. It was inviolation of CrPC section 144. People involved are being identified. Suitable action will be taken against them.”

Title: Kiran Bedi concerned over adhoc appointment of college directors
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Kiran Bedi

PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi expressed deep concern over the government’s practice of filling up the posts of directors and deans 'on adhoc basis' in professional and technical colleges run by government societies in the Union territory.

She requested the secretaries of the societies concerned to review the present position and take necessary action to fill up the posts through proper selection trials adhering to the recruitment rules.

Bedi insisted that the government must abolish the practice of filling up vital posts on adhoc basis in departments and higher and technical educational institutions run by societies. She said the growth of higher educational institutions has been hampered due to the current practice.

She welcomed the appointment of the director of Indira Gandhi medical college and research institute managed by Perunthalaivar Kamarajar medical college society in a fair and transparent manner by a selection committee through open an advertisement.

She said the government accepted the recommendation of the committee and issued the offer of appointment to the director.

"There are a number of similarly-placed professional/technical colleges run by government societies. It is noted with concern that in many such institutions the posts of director/dean have been filled and continued on an adhoc basis without following the provisions of relevant rules of recruitment. The administrative secretaries are requested to review the position and take steps to fill up the post of head of professional/technical institutions in a time-bound manner," she said.

Title: BAFTA nominations receive backlash after no actor in colour makes it to list
Content: British Academy of Films and Television Arts (BAFTA) earlier on Tuesday had unveiled the list of nominees to run in the upcoming award race but the online commentators are already in anger as not a single person of colour was nominated in the main acting categories.The list has satisfied the movie enthusiasts by fairly giving huge space to the films that one would predict like 'Joker', 'The Irishman' and many more.But many claims that the list showed scarcity in the acting category, where 20 names in total and all being entirely white.This notice of difference was quick to spark anger on social media and #BAFTAsSoWhite hashtag is seen trending.BAFTA gave a nod to Margot Robbie and Scarlett Johansson not one, but two nominations in the same category.BAFTA acknowledged the issue, and said, "We'd have liked to have seen more diversity in the nominations, it does continue to be an industry-wide issue,".BAFTA's director of awards, Emma Baehr, told a publication, "I think more films need to be made, and entered, giving people a chance to see them. We'd absolutely like to see more diversity, but I also don't want to take away from those celebrating today."Margot is nominated in the best supporting actor for 'Bombshell' and 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood ', while Scarlett in leading actor category for 'Marriage Story' and supporting actor for 'Jojo Rabbit.'

Title: Agra univ to teach how to test adulteration in food products
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Agra: Following approval of the University Grants Commission (UGC), Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University will, now, introduce a certificate course in ‘food analysis and quality assurance’. The skill-based course will be offered by the chemistry department of varsity’s institute of basic sciences located at the Khandari campus.

According to the university administration, the course will provide both theoretical and practical knowledge to the students. It is aimed at imparting the skill of finding adulteration in food and testing the overall quality of the food product.

Head of the chemistry department Professor Ajay Taneja said, “The certificate course in food analysis and quality assurance will be for a duration of six months. There will be 20 seats. After successful completion of the course, students will be issued a certificate. Associate professor has been made the coordinator of this new course.”

University administration has started the application process for the new certificate course. Students can apply through varsity’s official website till January 10. Students who have cleared intermediate can apply for this course. Fee for the course is Rs 10,000. Classes are likely to start in the next 10 days.

According to university officials, diploma and bachelor course in food analysis and quality assurance will be initiated later in 2020.

Title: Nagpur: BASA, ABVP hold separate protests at same place on campus
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Students under the banner of ABVP staged a protest inside the Nagpur University Campus on Tuesday to condem th... Read More

NAGPUR: Two groups — one led by Babasaheb Ambedkar Students Association (BASA) and the other by Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) — claiming to be students of Nagpur University (NU) staged individual protests one after the other to condemn the attack by masked goons on students of Delhi’s Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), at the Amravati Road campus on Tuesday morning.

Their request to hold simultaneous protests on either side of the entry point was turned down by cops. Both groups had organized the protests without police or university administration permission. Cops, who kept things under control for over three hours, warned they would be rounded up in case they stepped out of the campus.

The protesters stood inside the campus but right at the main entrance, blocking vehicular traffic from one side.

Ambazari cops handled the situation delicately by keeping both groups, having around 100 protesters each, away from each other till the end.

ABVP members, after speeches inside, tried to raise slogans outside on Amravati Road but were made to leave within minutes. Cops also didn’t allow any discussion among groups on the campus when the protests were underway. When BASA protest ended, cops asked them to report to their classroom or sit in the library till the ABVP agitation was going on.

The BASA members started their protests around 10am and were repeatedly asked by the cops to conclude the demonstration soon. The protesters requested more time as they wanted the teachers coming in by 11am to see their show of solidarity with the teaching community in view of the attack on JNU professors.

The ABVP protesters, who were asked to wait away from the main gate where BASA protest was underway, grew restless as time passed. Their request to let them hold a simultaneous protest on the other side of the entry point was turned down by the cops.

Sr PI Vijay Kare made it clear to ABVP members that unless BASA concludes their protest, they wouldn’t be allowed to start.

At 11am, as the BASA group relented and concluded their protest with the national anthem, ABVP members rushed to the entrance with loud slogans of Vande Mantram, Bharat Mata ki Jai, Tyar hojao sathiyo…bansi feko aur utha lo haatho mein hatiyar.

They slammed the Leftists, accusing them of “unleashing attacks on JNU students” even as news came in of Hindu Raksha Dal’s Pinky Chaudhary claiming responsibility for the Delhi episode.

ABVP’s Nagpur University campus pramukh Shrikant Malviya, who is a law student, distanced his organization from Hindu Raksha Dal’s Pinky Chaudhary. Malviya said people who want cheap publicity were making such comments.

The BASA members didn’t accuse any particular organization but accused hooligans of attacking innocent JNU students and demanded justice for them.

The NU administration remained a mute spectator to the developments on its premises.

Title: Chandigarh UT stops registering petrol, diesel autos
Content:
The UT administration has stopped registration of petrol, diesel, CNG and LPG auto rickshaws

The administration had recently submitted its action plan to the central government to control pollution

Auto can run on city roads for 15 years

CHANDIGARH: The UT administration has stopped registration of petrol, diesel, CNG and LPG auto rickshaws and is approving only e-rickshaws in a bid to check pollution and promote e-vehicles.The administration had recently submitted its action plan to the central government to control pollution. The UT had said it has already launched an extensive drive against polluting vehicles and prepared a plan to widen roads and improve infrastructure to decongest the roads.The Union ministry road transport and highways had suggested initiatives to promote electric vehicles, like waiving of toll charges, parking charges and issuing green registration number plates. The government has already framed a National Electric Mobility Mission Plan, which aims at promoting hybrid and electric vehicles in the country.A senior official of State Transport Authority (STA) said the UT is not registering petrol, diesel, CNG and LPG autos. It is only registering e-rickshaws with the STA, the official said.At present, there are 6,000 autos registered with the STA. The STA renews registration of autos only after fitness inspection necessary after every two years. Every auto owner has to renew the vehicle’s permit after every five years at a cost of Rs 5,000. A sum of Rs 300 is the fitness inspection fee after every two years for the first eight years and then after every year for the next seven years. An auto can run on the roads in Chandigarh for a maximum period of 15 years.According to the administration, a maximum of 6,000 autos registered with the STA can ply on Chandigarh roads. At present, nearly 3,000 autos are eligible for running in Chandigarh as others have not renewed their fitness inspection certificates and permits. A majority of them, who did not come for renewal of fitness inspection certificates and permits, were diesel-operated autos.Recently, the Punjab and Haryana high court had directed the administration to frame a policy about auto-rickshaws in the city.Meanwhile, the Chandigarh traffic police and STA has decided to jointly launch a drive against illegal autos plying in the city. The decision was taken in a joint meeting of the traffic police and STA officials.UT take up issue with Punjab and HaryanaThe UT administration recently pushed for restricting the entry of diesel-operated vehicles, including auto-rickshaws, from Punjab and Haryana into the cityThe issue was raised during a high-level meeting of the Tricity coordination committee held under the chairmanship of Punjab governor and UT administratorV P Singh Badnore around two months backDuring the meeting, the administration suggested Punjab and Haryana to restrict the entry of diesel-operated vehicles, including autos, into the city. This was suggested to keep a check on pollution level in the cityAutos bearing Haryana registration number are not allowed to enter Chandigarh for commercial and business purposes.Every auto owner has to renew the vehicle’s permit after every five years at a cost of Rs 5,000. A sum of Rs 300 is the fitness inspection fee after every two years for the first eight years and then after every year for the next seven years. An auto can run on the roads in Chandigarh for a maximum period of 15 years.According to the administration, a maximum of 6,000 autos registered with the STA can ply on Chandigarh roads. At present, nearly 3,000 autos are eligible for running in Chandigarh as others have not renewed their fitness inspection certificates and permits. A majority of them, who did not come for renewal of fitness inspection certificates and permits, were diesel-operated autos.Recently, the Punjab and Haryana high court had directed the administration to frame a policy about autorickshaws in the city.Meanwhile, the Chandigarh traffic police and STA has decided to jointly launch a drive against illegal autos plying in the city. The decision was taken in a joint meeting of the traffic police and STA officials.Meanwhile, the Chandigarh traffic police and STA has decided to jointly launch a drive against illegal autos plying in the city. The decision was taken in a joint meeting of the traffic police and STA officials.

Title: Bill passed to extend ST/SC quota by 10 years
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

PORVORIM: The Goa legislative assembly on Tuesday ratified the amendment bill made to the Constitution of India which will extend the reservation for scheduled caste/scheduled tribes (SC/ST) for another 10 years.

The bill which was tabled by the chief minister Pramod Sawant was passed unanimously by the members, though deputy chief minister Manohar Ajgaonkar expressed disappointment that he was not allowed to speak on the bill.

The one-day special session was called to ratify the central bill extending reservation to SC/ST in the Lok Sabha and assemblies by another ten years.

The House also passed the Goa Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Act, 2020 amid an uproar by the opposition, which was protesting after the adjournment motion filed by Goa Forward Party was rejected. They had sought the adjournment motion to discuss the Mhadei issue.
