The petitions moved by Jaganmohan Reddy and Sowbhagya came for hearing before the Chief Justice bench on Tuesday. However, as the petitions by Adinarayana Reddy and Ravi are pending with a single-judge bench and scheduled for hearing on Wednesday. Chief Justice J K Maheswari tagged all the petitions together for hearing by a single judge.

Title: TN: Darbar to release, but Lyca told to deposit Rs 5 crore for Malaysia show
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Darbar has been produced by investing Rs 220 crore

CHENNAI: The Rajinikanth starrer, Darbar , scheduled to be released on January 9 can hit screens everywhere but in Malaysia, said Madras high court on Tuesday. However, if the film’s producers — Lyca Productions Private Limited — deposit Rs 4.9 crore in the court, they are free to release the movie in Malaysia too, it added.

Justice G Jayachandran passed an order to this effect, on a civil suit iled by Malaysia-based film distributor DMY Creation SDN BHD claiming Rs 23 crore dues from Lyca for distributing various Tamil movies produced by Lyca, including Kaala and 2.0. The distributor wanted the court to stall the release of Darbar.

Opposing the plea, V Ragavachari, counsel for Lyca, submitted that the suit was bereft of details, unsupported by any pleadings or documents to support the contentions. The suit based on the premise that Lyca availed itself of loan from the distributor and liable to repay was fictitious, he said. Lyca is financially sound and there is no need to avail itself of loan from the applicant, he added.

“The allegation that Lyca obtained loan from the applicant is evidently and clearly false especially considering the background and financial position of the firm. Darbar has been produced by investing Rs 220 crore and if interim injunction is granted, Lyca will be put to irreparable loss and suffering,” Raghavachari added.

This apart, injunction cannot be granted for mere asking and there must be some strong case for irreparable loss, if interim injunction not granted. The balance of convenience is more in favour of Lyca who has invested heavily in the production of the movie and had widely advertised that the movie will be released on January 9 worldwide, he argued.

Noting that though the court is convinced by the submission made by Lyca against grant of injunction, the judge said, however, under equity, the right of the applicant who has made out a prima facie case should also be protected and passed the interim order.

Title: Eight-foot-long python rescued in Krishna dist
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Vijayawada: An eight-foot-long python was rescued by forest officials near Keesara village in Krishna district on Tuesday.

Village youths managed to capture the snake after some locals noticed it, and notified forest officials who reached the spot and rescued the reptile. Forest officials stated that python sightings in the area have become frequent. Usually, pythons in the region are found in hilly areas or in the Krishna estuary.

The recent floods in the Krishna has altered the habitat of snakes across the district, said forest officials, leading areas adjacent to the river — such as Vijayawada, Avanigadda, Nandigama and Kanchikacherla — become a breeding ground for the reptiles. The python would soon be released into the reserve forest area, said officials.

Title: Businessman acquitted in Pachgaon forest mining case
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Nagpur: The Kuhi judicial magistrate first class (JMFC), DU Rajput, has acquitted mining entrepreneur Anil Ramchandra Bhable in the infamous case of 2013 about quarrying on protected forest land in Pachgaon, 20km from Nagpur.

Bhable, who faced trial for over 6.5 years, was booked under various sections of the Indian Forest Act , 1927 and Forest Conservation Act , 1980 . TOI was the first to report violations of FCA by the mining industry in Pachgaon. The report created a storm.

Some top officials have been issued charge sheets in the case and cases have even been registered against the forest staff who turned a blind eye towards illegal mining.

In the present case, on December 4, 2012, during survey, the forest department had charged Bhable with encroaching upon 3.80-hectare forest land and excavating murrum in survey number 256.

Accordingly, a preliminary offence was registered against Bhable, who was arrested and goods and machinery worth crores were seized from his premises. He was also charged with causing royalty loss of Rs2.75 crore to the government.

Since the start of the case, Bhable pleaded innocence and alleged that he was falsely implicated as he did not succumb to the demands by foresters. During trial, all the forest officials who were involved in the process were cross-examined.

However, the forest department failed to prove that Bhable’s Om Construction Company quarried stones and removed forest produce. They also could not prove that the said firm encroached upon forest land.

RB Gaikwad, counsel for Bhable, argued that the forest department did not examine any independent witnesses and all the witnesses were forest employees.

To prove the charge of alleged encroachment, no land record officers were summoned. Besides, no proper procedure for measurement was followed.

Title: JNU violence protests: FIR against ‘Free Kashmir’ placard holder in Mumbai
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Mehak Mirza Prabhu holds a poster reading 'Free Kashmir' in Mumbai during a protest against the violence at J... Read More

MUMBAI: The Colaba police on Tuesday evening filed an FIR against Mehak Mirza Prabhu, the woman protester at the Gateway whose placard reading ‘ Free Kashmir ’ kicked up a storm with ex-CM Devendra Fadnavis and others alleging that the agitation in support of JNU students had taken on a divisive character.

Mehak was booked under Section 153B of the IPC for imputations and assertions prejudicial to national integration. No arrest has been made. Conviction attracts jail for a maximum of five years.

The FIR was filed suo motu by Colaba police. It came after home minister Anil Deshmukh of the NCP said that the state would probe the matter and after Shiv Sena and NCP leaders had defended Mehak. She sought to clarify her position in a video she put out on social media and in a chat with TOI, saying she was speaking only of “basic constitutional rights” and “freedom of expression” in J&K in view of the “internet shutdown” there.

Responding to Fadnavis’s tweet on the matter, NCP’s water resources minister Jayant Patil tweeted: “Devendraji It’s ‘free Kashmir’ from all discriminations, bans on cellular networks and central control. I can’t believe that responsible leader like you trying (sic) to confuse people by decoding words in such a hatred way. Is it losing power or losing self-control.”

A senior police officer said they would examine Mehak’s profile on social media. “We have to scan all the information about her in order to establish in what context she was carrying the poster,” an IPS officer said on Tuesday afternoon.

Speaking about what she termed as the “abuse, hate and narrative” that the image of her holding up the poster had spawned, Mehak told TOI, “I have been in too much distress. I’m an artiste, I tell stories and I was there like everyone else with no other agenda. I did not write or create that poster. It was lying around, which I happened to lift and hold up.”

In her 3.26-minute video on social media, she said her intentions had been “misinterpreted”. She said, “Yesterday, on January 6th, around 7pm, I reached where the protest was happening at the Gateway of India . Like anybody else who believes in democracy, I also joined the protest. There were groups of people singing songs and raising slogans about various issues. We were there to demand justice for JNU students, but as I moved around, I saw people painting placards on everything from NRC, CAA, JNU students... that’s when I noticed a placard lying around that read ‘Free Kashmir’. The first thought that came to my mind was the fact that we were there to demand basic constitutional rights and knowing about the Internet shutdown over the past five months in Kashmir, I felt that people there deserved the freedom to express themselves like us too. In fact, I held a flower in my hand too as an offering of peace.”

Stating that things had been “blown out of proportion” and she had been labelled as a “member of a gang,” the 37-year-old stressed on her background as a Maharashtrian and a storytelling artiste. “The picture created by social media came as an absolute shock to me,” she said. “If by being naive in understanding the impact it would have, and in the process (having) created this stir, I apologise. As a woman it is scary for my safety. Itna darr ke jeena humey nahi chahiyein.”

She told TOI her friend and creative partner Mohammad Muneem, a Kashmiri singer-songwriter, had no role to play in her act of holding up the placard and that he was away in Pune on Monday.

Earlier in the day, home minister Anil Deshmukh said, “We will check the protester’s antecedents. If she is found to have a history of creating nuisance and her intentions were anti-national, action will be taken,”

Sena parliamentary party leader Sanjay Raut said, “I read in the newspaper that those who held the ‘Free Kashmir’ banner clarified they want to be free of restrictions on internet services, mobile services and other issues.” However, he added that “if anyone talks of freedom of Kashmir from India, it will not be tolerated.” Sena minister Aaditya Thackeray tweeted, “Apart from that incident look at larger picture, yes we need to see her intent, was it to remove internet blockade, if it was freeing Kashmir from India then it’s wrong. Obviously everyone condemned it, not even other protesters supported it.”

Ex-BJP MP Kirit Somaiya said, “Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut endorsed the anti-India ‘Kashmir ko chahiye Azadi’ protest at Gateway of India. Does Sena want Article 370 in Kashmir again? How many compromises will Sena bear for power?”

Box

Apart from the FIR against Mehak Mirza Prabhu, three other cases were registered by the police on Tuesday evening in connection with Monday’s protests over the JNU violence . Two FIRs were filed for unlawful assembly against JNU student leader Umar Khalid and other activists and one was lodged against members of the Akhil Bharti Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) for unlawful assembly. No one has been arrested.

The Colaba police, who booked Mehak, registered an FIR against Khalid and activists Firoz Mithiborwala, Suvarna Salve and others for unlawful assembly at the Gateway. The MRA Marg police station in south Mumbai registered two FIRs: one against 31 protesters including Khalid, Salve and Mithiborwala for taking out a morcha from Hutatma Chowk to the Gateway of India and the other against ABVP students for their protest at Hutatma Chowk.

Title: Tabla, mridangam drum home power of collaboration
Content:
Tabla maestro Yogesh Samsi was joined by mridangam stalwart Anantha Krishna on Day 6 of Saptak, on Monday. In ... Read More

Know your raga

AHMEDABAD: Tabla maestro Yogesh Samsi was joined by mridangam stalwart Anantha Krishna on Day 6 of Saptak, on Monday. In the drumroll introducing the festival’s unforgettable moments, Samsi’s presence will resound often. For instance, the percussive cushions he provided for Pandit Birju Maharaj in 2011 is still remembered by Saptak old-timers. Samsi himself is self-effacing. Therefore, it was gratifying for rasikas to see him at the centre of the stage on Monday.Anantha Krishna’s mridangam passages clarified both the silences and emphases of Samsi’s account. The collaboration recalled one of the best Hindustani-Carnatic alliances on the Saptak stage, which was evidenced in 2013. That performance brought together Dhrupad grandees Pandits Ramakant and Umakant Gundecha and Carnatic notables Shriramkumar Malladi and Ravikumar Malladi.“Bhava, raga, taala sumadhura sangeetam, brahmananda dayakam” (music, with feeling and euphony, offers bliss) was the finale of the quartet. Malladis’ flourish — as extravagant as wedding jewellery — lay encased in the Gundechas’ austere chants. The contrast was so startling that many in the audience sprang to their feet to applaud when the recital dipped into periods of momentary silence.On Monday, Samsi and Anantha Krishna were accompanied by Bangalore Amrit on the khanjira and Tanmay Deochake on the harmonium. Deochake opened the presentation with a solo foray. The spell of contemplation smoothed the start of a new day. As is often the case, Saptak’s final baithak had slipped past midnight.Earlier on Monday, the programme had featured kathakar Vishal Krishna and vocalist Kaivalya Kumar. The expansiveness of the schedule pleased rasikas. They had been initially disappointed with the cancellation of Pandit Shivkumar Sharma’s recital. The santoor icon had fallen ill. Incidentally, Samsi was to accompany Pandit Sharma.Kafi: ‘Kaali Ghodi Dwar Khadi’ of “Chashme Buddoor” rides on this ragaListener's Glossary:Dhrupad: Combination of ‘Dhruva’, signifying ‘fixed’; and ‘pada’, or ‘verse’.Today’s events:1) Shri Amaan Ali Bangash – Sarod2) Pt. Swapan Chaudhuri – Tabla3) Pt. Ajoy Chakraborty – Vocal

Title: Chandigarh: Manimajra as Sector 13 move challenged in court
Content:
The petition argues that Manimajra is a historical town with an old fort and changing its name will hurt the s... Read More

The decision to rename

Manimajra

as Sector 13 has been challenged in the district court while citing its historical importance and sentiments of the people attached to the name

CHANDIGARH: The decision to rename Manimajra as Sector 13 has been challenged in the district court while citing its historical importance and sentiments of the people attached to the name.Lawyers for Humanity, an NGO, has filed a petition against the UT administration, deputy commissioner and Resident Welfare Association of Modern Housing Complex, Manimajra, seeking the authorities be restrained from changing the name.The matter would come up for hearing on Wednesday.The petition mentioned that Manimajra is a historical town situated in the foothills of Shivalik range, established 600 years ago by its then ruler Gharib Dass. The petition said Manimajra witnessed many historical events and has a 600-year-old fort. It also has a social and religious importance as the ‘Sidh peeth’ of Mansa Devi temple is situated in the periphery of Manimajra, the petition said.Manimajra has a historical gurudwara, Mata Raj Kaur Gurdwara, situated in the fort. The petition said Gurdwara Khooni Sahib in Manimajra has a historical background as Guru Gobind Singh had visited the place. Manimajra also has a ‘Thakurdwara’, which is 500 to 600 years old. It was built by the rulers of the area and is dedicated to Rama, Hanuman and Sita.The petition said the authorities are ignoring the facts and sentiments of local people. Advocate Ravinder Bassi said the original inhabitants of the town are against the move, while only a few people hailing from other places are in its favour.The petition said the name change would hurt the sentiments and feelings of the people of the locality as well as other devotees of religious places situated in the town.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Wife of accused, seven policemen held; three cops suspended
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: A day after an undertrial in a triple murder case allegedly shot himself using a countrymade pistol in the presence of police in Mainpuri district court, police on Tuesday arrested his wife and seven policemen for criminal conspiracy. 3 other cops have been suspended and slapped with a show cause notice.

The murder case accused, 30-year-old Manish along with Kallu and Jitendra were produced in the court of Additional District Judge-IV, Tarun Kumar Singh for hearing in the 2012 triple murder case on Monday. Police said that Manish, in connivance with Kallu and Jitendra, had on October 9, 2012 shot dead his father Sukhram, stepmother Sushma Devi and brother Abhishek over a property dispute under Karhal police station area of the district.

During the hearing in the case, when Manish was asked to personally explain the circumstances on the day of the crime by appearing in the court, he took out a countrymade weapon and shot at his right foot. Manish was sent to district hospital for treatment and later arrested again.

On Tuesday, CO (Mainpuri city) Abhay Narayan Singh said Manish, in his statement to the police, had said that the pistol was given to him by his sister’s husband Prince. However, gunshot residue samples and fingerprints were taken from the 312 bore countrymade pistol Manish had used. “We questioned each member separately and also asked them to undergo lie-detector tests to sort out the case,” said Singh. Manish’s wife Seema Yadav broke down and disclosed she had hidden the pistol she got from brother Vinod in her clothes and had passed it on to her husband. A case was filed against Seema and she was arrested. The CO said efforts were on to arrest Vinod. Two inspectors, two male constables, a woman constable and two local intelligence constables have also been arrested.

Title: Meena named new land reforms commissioner
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Gandhinagar: R C Meena (1997 batch IAS), secretary, NRI (non resident Indians) and ART (administrative reforms & training) division, has been appointed commissioner of land reforms and ex-officio secretary, revenue department, relieving Pankaj Kumar, additional chief secretary (ACS), revenue department, from the additional charge.

Dhananjay Dwivedi (1998 batch IAS), secretary, Narmada, water resources, water supply and Kalpasar, has been given additional charge of the NRI and ART division.

B A Shah (2009 batch IAS), registrar of cooperatives societies, has been appointed director of Gujarat energy development agency (GEDA). He will also continue to hold the additional charge of chief town planner.

D P Desai (2008 batch IAS), director, schools, has been transferred and appointed registrar, co-operative societies. P Bharathi (2005 batch IAS), director, Sarva Shiksha Abhiyaan, will hold additional charge of director, schools.

Title: Arrow fractures Surat student’s skull
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Surat: A 13-year-old student suffered a fracture in skull when he was hit by an arrow while playing on the ground of Poddar International School here on Saturday. The boy was operated upon at a private hospital on Monday but remains serious, his father said.

Tejas Dadhich, a student of class VIII of Podar International School, Sarthana was hit by an arrow in head. He collapsed on ground and immediately shifted to a private hospital by school authorities.

“I received a call from the school authorities that my son had suffered an injury and is admitted to a private hospital. His skull was fractured and condition serious and hence I shifted him to a hospital which specializes in neurological surgeries,” said Manoj, father of Tejas.

“I was told by the school authorities that Tejas was playing in one portion of the ground while in the adjoining some students were practising archery. By chance, an arrow crossed a six-foot wall and hit Tejas in head. I just want my son to return home safe without any health issues,” said Manoj, a textile businessman.

Meanwhile, hospital authorities alerted cops and they registered statement of the boy. However, so far no case has been registered. “I am not aware about the incident, but will inquire what exactly had happened,” said T R Chaudhary, police inspector, Sarthana police station.

“I am not aware if the school is under my jurisdiction. If it is not, then it is not our responsibility to look into the matter,” said H H Rajyaguru, district education officer, Surat.

“The school is shocked by the accident that involved two students engaged in sports activities on campus. The school is working together with officials of education department to ensure such an incident is not repeated in future,” said B D Kotwani, principal of Podar International School.

Title: JNU violence: Gateway protest melts away at Azad Maidan
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Demonstrators after being shited to Azad Maidan on Tuesday

MUMBAI: After over 34 hours of spontaneous sloganeering, chants and creative posters at the Gateway of India against the brutal violence at JNU , the protesters were pushed to Azad Maidan , the city’s designated protest area, early on Tuesday. Soon after, the students called off the #OccupyGateway protest and dispersed. Some of them have extended support to Wednesday’s bandh.

Four FIRs were filed in the evening against the protesters, but no arrests have been made.

Members of several organisations met on Tuesday evening to review the sit-in protest and plan ahead. “We were reviewing the logistics and coordination during the protest at Gateway to ensure that further programmes are smooth. We will continue the month-long schedule of protests,” said Bilal Khan, one of those who attended the meeting.

What had started as an impromptu protest around midnight on Sunday saw thousands of students and citizens join in throughout Monday. A few hundred stayed back on Monday night as well. “We had a very exciting night at Gateway, where we continued chanting and we were going to sing the national anthem around 6.30am when the police came and asked us to move to Azad Maidan. Some of us tried to reason with the cops but it was futile. Soon, the police began pushing people into their vans and drove them to Azad Maidan,” said a protester.

The police said they kept telling the protesters prohibitory orders had been imposed, but they refused to listen. They did not want to take action against women at night and so moved them in the morning. As many as 600 police personnel were deployed between Gateway and Azad Maidan. “They were inconveniencing the public and we also received complaints of traffic jam at Gateway,” said an officer after shifting the protesters to Azad Maidan.

Those shifted claimed they were not allowed to leave immediately. “The police wanted an assurance that we would not return to Gateway. After lawyers helped us out, we were allowed to go but only after recording details and verifying identity cards,” said the protester. “We took down their names, contact details and information about their identity cards, if available. It is to ensure transparency on those protesting at the maidan and to record that they left. If someone says he was beaten up by cops, we have a person’s identity and it would be easier to verify it,” said the officer.

Social media was buzzing on Tuesday morning with messages requesting protesters to convene again at Gateway and Azad Maidan, but the protesters clarified they had called off #OccupyGateway. “Since the protest at Gateway was spontaneous, there was not a lot of coordination. Hence we decided to disperse, plan and continue our protest,” said Akshay Sawant, an IIT-Bombay student and member of the Joint Action Committee, which extended support to the Bharat Bandh on Wednesday.

As the crowds thinned at Azad Maidan around noon, several volunteers were seen packing excess supplies like food, blankets, sanitary napkins, etc which citizens had donated. “We will send it back to NGOs or shelter homes where they can be used. The perishable items are being given out to the ongoing protests,” said a student.

Nearly 200 students, faculty and alumni from IIT-B carried out a demonstration on the second consecutive day in solidarity with the JNU students. In Malad, a few ABVP members gathered on Tuesday morning to condemn “the violence perpetrated by Leftist goons in JNU”. Members said they were planning to hold similar protests in the city over the next few days.

Mumbai police and DCP Sangram Singh Nishandar were feted on social media for their calm handling of the protests. Actor Sonam Kapur tweeted, “Thank you @Mumbaipolice for your patience and doing your job. All my friends who attended the protests are all praises. It makes my heart swell in pride.”

Title: Startup with nano solution for wastewater is ‘Pride of India’
Content:
Team JK Solutions, which won the Best Startup of Pride of India Expo award

BENGALURU: A startup that sprouted here amid unfortunate circumstances nine years ago bagged the ‘Best Startup of Pride of India Expo’ award at Indian Science Congress, 2020, on Tuesday.In 2011, lakhs of textile workers in Tamil Nadu lost their jobs following a Supreme Court order shutting down factories for discharging effluents into rivers. The water pollution that pushed lakhs of people into joblessness also inspired scientists — Dr SCG Kiruba Daniel, Suthanthira Daniel and their colleagues — to find something to stop the hazard at the source, at a lower cost and with lesser effort. Thus came into existence Nanosolution, the brainchild of their venture JK Solutions , which was launched in Bengaluru in 2017 and incubated at IISc.Nanosolution is a liquid-based solution consisting of metal nanoclusters which, on being introduced in polluted water, draws foreign particles and sinks to the bottom as organic sludge. The founders claim the method recovers 98% of water. It is at work in BMTC and three dhobi ghats — including at Vyalikaval and Srinagar — where it treats and recycles around 1.5 lakh litres of wastewater everyday.Daniel said one litre of the solution can treat 1,000 to 2,000 litres of wastewater. “The nanotechnology-based product is a simple, one-step, rapid, low-cost solution,” he said, adding that treatment costs up to Rs 1.30 per litre, one-tenth of the regular cost. JK Solutions claims to have treated over 10 million litres of water for reuse since its inception.VP: Inventions can ward off threat to food safetyThe solution to the growing threat to food security lies in novel ideas, inventions and efforts by the scientific community, Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu said in his valedictory speech at ISC on Tuesday.Stressing the need to inculcate morals along with science among schoolkids, he said: “When we were young, we had moral science classes. Today, science continues, while morals have vanished,” Naidu said. He said people should “go online, instead of standing in a line”.“People will stand in a line, shake hands and do much more (grease palms). Direct benefit transfer will avoid it all,” he said.

Title: Bedrolls for all Jaipur-C’garhGarib Rath passengers
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Jaipur: The North Western Railway will provide bedrolls to all passengers travelling in the Jaipur-Chandigarh Garib Rath from May 15.

Abolishing the previous system of optional bedrolls, the NWR will provide it to all passengers for a few extra bucks which will be added to the fare. For a long time, railway authorities had been getting complaints of chaos in the train during distribution of bedrolls in Jaipur-Chandigarh Garib Rath since it was handled by private vendors.

There are also complaints of overcharging, poor linen and rush while the vendor used to distribute the bedrolls.

In other trains, bedroll costs are included in the ticket fares. “Currently, people travelling in Jaipur-Chandigarh Garib Rath are required to pay Rs 25 per bedroll. With the new system, the charges for the bedroll would be deducted in the ticket itself and every passenger will get one in the train,” said a senior officer of NWR. NWR chief public relations officer Abhay Sharma said, “The facility will be available for passengers from May 15 onwards. While travelling in Jaipur-Chandigarh and Chandigarh-Jaipur Garib Rath, all passengers will get bedrolls. It has now been made compulsory for all. Earlier, passengers were facing difficulties.” Sharma said those who had already booked tickets in advance, cannot avail this facility.

Title: Tahsildar booked for sexual harassment
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Vijayawada: A tahsildar of Kurichedu village was accused of sexual harassment by his sub-ordinate, a village revenue assistant, in Prakasam district on Tuesday.

Sources in the police said, they received a complaint from the VRA against the tahsildar DVB Varakumar claiming that he made advance and later made derogatory statements against her.

The complainant explained that she had invited all the staff, including Varakumar, for a Christmas dinner at her home on December 25. However, Varakumar did not turn up for the event and later on December 28, he demanded a ‘special dinner’ for him separately. The VRA claimed that he then suddenly hugged and tried to force himself on her.

However, Varakumar has denied her allegations and stated that the authorities can investigate the matter. He also accused the VRA of running a malicious campaign against him.

A case of sexual harassment has been registered against him by Kurichedu police.

Title: Can’t release Rajiv Gandhi killers: Centre to Madras HC
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Madras HC

CHENNAI: The Centre on Tuesday informed the Madras high court that the Tamil Nadu government’s proposal to release seven life convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, including Nalini Sriharan, has been rejected by it in April 2018 since it would lead to “international ramifications”.

Additional solicitor general G Rajagopalan made the submission on behalf of the home ministry on the plea moved by Nalini seeking to declare her detention as illegal since the governor had failed to act upon the recommendation of the state cabinet to release the seven convicts.

Recording the submissions, a division bench of Justice R Subbiah and Justice R Pongiyappan impleaded the Union home ministry as party respondent and directed it to file a counter by January 28.

In the rejection order produced by the solicitor general, the home ministry had stated: ‘The case involves assassination of a former prime minister of the country who was brutally killed in pursuance of diabolical plot carefully conceived and executed by a highly organised foreign terrorist organisation. Sixteen innocent lives were lost and many sustained grievous injuries in the gruesome, inhuman, uncivilised, and merciless bomb blast which was successfully enacted with active help and participation of these convicts and others who were LTTE militants or its staunch supporters.”

“The CBI has opposed the state government’s proposal to release the convicts in the interest of justice. The case has been reviewed, scrutinised by various forums of the judiciary and executive and both the highest judicial forum as well as the executive forum has elevated the case and decided the matter. Releasing the four foreign nationals who had committed the gruesome murder of former PM in connivance with three Indian nationals will set a very dangerous precedent and lead to international ramifications by other such criminals in the future,” the order said.

Title: Ahmedabad: ‘Celibate’ man thrashes wife for asking for sex
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A woman was beaten for demanding sex from her husband, who claims to have taken up celibacy. Her in-laws also allegedly thrashed her when they found out about the issue. A complaint in this regard was filed at the Women’s police station (east) against the husband and in-laws, under the Domestic Violence Act on Monday.

In her FIR, the woman, 22, a resident of Danilimda , states that she married with a man from Sarkhej , who is now 25, on May 14, 2016. Initially, her husband’s behaviour towards her was decent but changed after she delivered their first child in 2018.

“For the past few months, my husband had stopped having sex with me. Whenever I asked for it, he got furious and beat me,” states the complainant, adding that her husband claims to have adopted celibacy.

When she insisting on having sex, her husband left their house. Due to this, her in-laws began harassing and beating her, saying she had forced him to leave.

The woman states that her husband was in stress due over money he had borrowed from various moneylenders, and had even stopped caring for her and their child.

“A few months ago, when my son had a severe infection in his intestine, my husband did not even pay for medicines,” she states in the FIR.

The woman had on Monday approached police and filed a complaint for domestic violence and abetment against her husband and four of her in-laws. The accused have not yet been arrested.

Title: Two more held for violent clashes in NE Delhi in Dec
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

New Delhi: Two more people have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the clashes that broke out in north-east Delhi’s Seelampur during the protests against Citizenship Amendment Act in December.

Nineteen people, including five Bangladeshi immigrants , were arrested earlier for allegedly throwing stones, damaging public properties and setting buses on fire. The accused arrested on Wednesday have been identified as Shehzad (23) and Noor Mohammad (19).

DCP Rajesh Deo said the men were identified and arrested through an electronic surveillance system and after analysing the videos of the clashes. “Shehzad was found to be a notorious history sheeter of Seelampur involved in many criminal cases. Noor has no criminal record,” he said. Noor had recorded some videos and pictures of the violence on his mobile phone and both were also seen throwing stones in a CCTV footage, a source claimed.

A special investigation team (SIT) identified both of them while scanning the CCTV footage from the area. The team got some blurry images, which were enhanced to identify the subjects.

The cops claimed that all five Bangladeshi immigrants had been staying in JJ colonies in the Delhi border areas illegally. SIT is now looking into the funding of the protest and trying to find out if any foreign source was involved.

Title: EWS norms different for RTE & higher edu institutes
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Jaipur: The state government is in a fix over setting different criteria for economically weaker sections (EWS) for admissions under Right to Education (RTE) Act and 10% quota for general category EWS in higher educational institutes and government jobs. The EWS criteria under RTE is Rs 1 lakh annual income, while for those seeking reservation in higher educational institutes and government jobs, it is Rs 8 lakh per annum.

The RTE Act section 2 (E) empowers state to determine the income limit for EWS category for the purpose of 25% admissions in the private schools. Exercising its powers, state determined Rs 1 lakh for EWS category in the last two years. This is the only benefit under the EWS category till the advent of 10% reservation quota for general category EWS introduced in 2018.

The issue surfaced after Constitution (103rd Amendment Act) Act, 2019 introduced 10% reservation for the EWS for the admission in government educational institutions and employment in the public services. The income eligibility thereupon has been settled at Rs 8 lakh/annum along with other criteria. Thereafter, state government on October 20 made Rs 8 lakh annual income, the sole criteria to avail EWS reservation in Rajasthan.

A delegation of RTE activists has uprised the CMO officials highlighting the complexities of having two definitions for one subject, on Tuesday. “The two disparate definitions of EWS Section in a state is a breach of reasonable classification under Article 14 of the Indian constitution and led to ambiguity in the public policy. By law, two definitions cannot stand legal scrutiny. Government has no choice other than taking raising the income limit to Rs 8 lakh for EWS for RTE,” said Pranjal Singh, president of Abhyutthanam Society, who submitted his representation to CMO officials. “During the meeting with principal secretary to CM Kuldeep Ranka and special secretary to CM Aarti Dogra, the legal implications of the two definitions have been explained. They have assured to take affirmative action on my plea,” said Singh.

The issue has started being discussed within the education department officials and at CM level. This is the time of the year, state frames rules and guidelines for the RTE admissions. Education minister Govind Singh Dotasra feels that any rise in the income limit will defeat the purpose of the RTE act. “Rs 8 lakh for EWS criteria for RTE admissions will invite vast number of applications and those deserving will be left behind. The issue is being discussed with CM Ashok Gehlot. Hoping to find a reasonable solution soon,” said Dotasra.

Title: Maharashtra zilla parishad elections: 67% polling in Nagpur, counting today
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

An elderly couple casts vote for the Zilla Parishad elections in Nagpur district on Tuesday

NAGPUR: The election for Nagpur zilla parishad and panchayat samitis witnessed around 67% polling on Tuesday. The counting will be held on Wednesday and the picture will be clear by afternoon though final results are officially declared in the evening.

There were no untoward incidents in the district. Police had taken preventive action against 135 anti-social elements before polling. There were very few complaints regarding malfunctioning of electronic voting machines (EVMs). However, many people complained about errors in voters’ lists.

Complaints were received by the administration that names of some people in polling booths of Mansar-Shitalwadi circle were missing. Similar complaints were received from Nagardhan circle.

The maximum enthusiasm among voters was seen in Mouda and Kuhi talukas, which witnessed over 60% polling by 3.30pm. The figure for Mouda taluka was 62.42% while that of Kuhi was 62.51%. Against this Nagpur Rural taluka, which has a lot of semi-urban areas witnessed only 41.78% voting.

Anjana Wakde (95) voted at the polling booth at Kolbaswami junior college, Dhapewada. She told the media that she had voted in every election since she was 21 (the previous minimum age for voting). Mira Bagde, a 70-year-old physically challenged woman, voted at Pipla village in the afternoon. She came with her family members in a car.

Each voter had to cast two votes – one for ZP member and one for PS member. Such type of multiple voting is now common in local body elections.

Counting will be held at 13 tehsil offices. Some 2,000 government staffers have been deployed for counting duty. There will be 16 EVMs on each counting table. As the same EVM contained list of ZP and PS candidates, the counting process is simpler this time and is expected to be faster.

The first result is expected by 12 noon. By around noon results of 13 ZP circles and 26 PS will be declared. As one round will take two hours the final tally will be known between 6pm and 8pm.

Akola ZP witnessed around 56% voting. Most seats are witnessing quadrangular fight between Congress-NCP , Shiv Sena, BJP and Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi (VBA). The VBA’s earlier avatar BRP-BMS has been in power in Akola ZP since years. This time another government may come to power.

Washim ZP witnessed around 65% voting. There is no alliance between Congress and NCP in this district. The fight here too is quadrangular between Congress, NCP, BJP and Sena.

Title: Rajasthan high court puts govt on notice over infant deaths
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

File picture of a woman with her child at J K Lon Hospital in Kota.

JODHPUR: Taking note of the recent deaths of infants in hospitals across the state, the Rajasthan high court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Ashok Gehlot government, seeking several details and a reply on this “serious matter”.

A division bench headed by chief justice Indrajit Mahanty asked the government for details like how many children have died, what were the causes of their deaths and how many posts were lying vacant in those hospitals. The matter has been listed for next hearing on February 10.

While the court was hearing a petition pertaining to mortality of 90 infants in the Mahatma Gandhi Hospital of Banswara in 2017, the amicus curiae on Tuesday brought to the notice of the HC the recent deaths of children in hospitals in Kota, Jodhpur and Bikaner .

“We requested the court that the government be asked to come out with a reply on what was the exact number of deaths, causes of these deaths and what steps were taken with regard to fixing responsibility,” said amicus curiae Rajvendra Saraswat.

The court not just admitted the prayer of the amicus curiae, it also sought reply about the posts of doctors and other staff lying vacant in the hospitals and how treatment of patients was being carried out with shortage of staff, if any.

The HC also gave directions to the government to computerize district hospitals so that the record of each patient could be maintained, which would be helpful in obtaining correct data.

Further, the bench directed the amicus curiae and additional advocate general Pankaj Sharma to carry out a sudden inspection of any two government hospitals and submit a report on the conditions there during the next hearing.

Title: Village panchayat member held taking bribe from hawker
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Amrat Patel

Surat: The anti-corruption bureau (ACB) sleuths arrested member of Kalsar village panchayat in Valsad for allegedly accepting bribe of Rs 2,000 from a hawker on Tuesday. The accused Amrat Patel had demanded the money from the hawker to allow him to do business on the village road.

Patel was arrested while accepting bribe of Rs 2,000 from the complainant near Vadiya cross road.

The complainant sells shoes and helmets on road and keeps on shifting on regular intervals.

Patel had demanded the money to allow him to do business on public road in the village. According to ACB officials, Patel used to demand the money every month.

The complainant finally had approached ACB following a trap was laid by police inspector D M Vasava under supervision of N P Gohil, assistant director, ACB.

Title: TechM opens delivery centre in Warangal
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Hyderabad: IT major Tech Mahindra Ltd on Tuesday announced the opening of its new delivery centre in Warangal, Telangana. The centre is expected to have a capacity to accommodate around 100 people.

Tech Mahindra said in a release that the new facility is in line with its TechMNxt charter, which focuses on leveraging next generation technologies and solutions like artificial intelligence to disrupt and enable digital transformation and to build and deliver cutting-edge technology solutions and services to address real world problems to meet the customer’s evolving and dynamic needs.

Tech Mahindra’s MD & CEO CP Gurnani said the opening of the new centre in collaboration with the Telangana government is a step towards enabling the talented workforce in tier-2 cities to collaborate and co-create smart and sustainable solutions for the future by leveraging next generation technologies.

He said Warangal is home to several reputed educational institutions and has huge potential to not only nurture the talent pipeline through skilling in emerging technologies but is also poised to fuel growth in textiles, life sciences and other industry verticals like IT and digital.

“Global players like Tech Mahindra can play a role in bridging the local-global divide. We hope the new campus will help us in addressing the evolving technology needs of local industries, besides significantly improving the skills and employability of the talent in these cities,” he said.

Telangana IT and industries minister KT Rama Rao said the opening of Tech Mahindra’s Warangal campus is an important step in the government’s efforts to digitally transform Warangal and other tier-II cities by riding the immense potential of the people and leveraging new age technologies like AI and Blockchain.

Title: Chandigarh: Two held for phone pay app fraud
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: The cyber cell of the UT police has arrested two residents of Mathura in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly duping a city resident through a mobile payment app.

Chandan Pathania, a resident of Manimajra, had posted an advertisement to sell his old mobile phone on OLX in December 2019. Sonu, one of the accused, allegedly contacted him on his phone. Later, a deal was struck at Rs 9,000. The accused told Pathania that he would make the payment through a phone app. Pathania shared details of his account with Sonu. Later, Pathania alleged he received a link from Sonu on his mobile phone and when he clicked it, a sum of Rs 7,000 was deducted from his bank account. Police arrested Sonu and his accomplice Dharmender.

Police said the two during their interrogation revealed the names of two more accomplices belonging to Bharatpur in Rajasthan and Mathura. Raids are being conducted nab them, police said.

A court on Tuesday remanded the two accused in two-day police custody.

Title: Applying for gun licence in ESZ area, expect forest department’s visit
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

CHANDIGARH: If you are residing in the area falling under the eco-sensitive zone (ESZ) of Sukhna Wildlife Sanctuary and have applied for an arms licence in the UT, be ready for a detailed verification by the forest and wildlife department too.

UT chief wildlife warden Debendra Dalai has issued directions to its staff to visit applicant’s house personally if one is residing in the ESZ area, and check his background before issuing the NOC for the arms licence.

Three villages of Chandigarh — Khuda Ali Sher, Kishangarh and Kaimbwala — come under the ESZ.

Dalai said the forest department team will check whether the person has any case in the past related to wildlife act or not. The exercise is aimed to protect wildlife sanctuary, he added.

In Chandigarh, an applicant applies at the deputy commissioner’s office for arms licence and NOC is required from UT police department and chief wildlife warden.

Dalai said they are also pushing for early declaration of eco sensitive zone (ESZ) by the Punjab and Haryana governments as well.

Till date, the Union ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has issued final notification on ESZ around the sanctuary for Chandigarh alone while Punjab and Haryana have not declared such zones in their respective territories. The UT is pushing that Punjab and Haryana should also follow in its footsteps as it has declared area varying from 2km to 2.75km from the sanctuary boundary as ESZ.

The administration in past had opposed the Punjab government’s proposal. In a letter written to the Union government on July 25, 2014, the UT had stated that Punjab’s limit of 100 metres is very small and more so specially when the areas adjoining Sukhna Wildlife Sanctuary in Punjab are being developed as high density area in Nagar Panchayat Nayagaon municipal area and therefore, had recommended that at least 1 km distance should be notified as ESZ for the area falling in Punjab.

Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Clash erupt between members of NSUI and ABVP during a protest in Ahmadabad on Tuesday.(ANI photo)

Title: Sachin Pilot longest serving PCC president in Rajasthan
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Sachin Pilot

JAIPUR: Deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot will become the longest serving (uninterrupted) PCC chief of the state on Wednesday. He equalled the record of veteran Congress leader Late Parasram Maderna on Tuesday. Pilot will complete six years on January 21.

He assumed the post of PCC president on January 21, 2014 replacing Dr Chandraban after the party suffered its worst ever electoral defeat in the assembly polls in 2013. The party was reduced to just 21 seats in the 200-member house.

It was, however, not a cake walk for the young leader who was elected to the Lok Sabha from Dausa in 2004 at the age of 26, which his father and Late Union minister Rajesh Pilot represented.

The Congress lost all the 25 Lok Sabha seats in the Lok Sabha polls in 2019. Sachin, who was a minister in the UPA government, lost his Lok Sabha seat of Ajmer in 2014.

The party under his leadership took on the BJP hitting the streets raising public issues. The Congress was able to defeat the ruling party in all the bypolls except Dholpur. The defeat of the ruling party in Alwar and Ajmer Lok Sabha seats and Mandalgarh assembly seat had set the tone for the assembly elections in December 2018.

He is credited with reviving a moribund party to take on the might of the BJP. The result was for everybody to see with the party bouncing back to power in the state. Sachin, elected to the assembly from Tonk and a claimant to the top job in the state, had to satisfy with the post of deputy chief minister under Ashok Gehlot as the party decided in favour of experience over youth.

The latest challenge for this MBA from the prestigious Wharton School in the US is the upcoming panchayat elections in the state.

Title: Rajasthan: Govt, NTPC to sign MoU for solar park in Jaisalmer
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The government is set to ink an agreement with NTPC for developing a 925 megawatt solar park in Jaisalmer that would fetch nearly Rs 4,000 core investment. The ultra-mega solar park at Nokh, spread over 1850 hectare, will be the first project for developing a park under the new solar policy announced last month.

Sources in the RRECL said that discussions and decisions with NTPC have taken a definite shape for developing the Nokh Ultra Mega Solar Park and an agreement is likely to be signed very soon.

When TOI contacted RRECL chairman Ajitabh Sharma, he confirmed that the discussions with NTPC are at an advanced stage and the Central PSU is very keen to develop the park for which land has already been in possession.

“We have already had several rounds of discussions with NTPC and they have shown willingness to develop the park. While we have ticked most of the boxes, which are critical to the project, they are a couple of aspects that need to be finalized by NTPC. We are expecting the process to be over very soon for the MoU to be signed,” added Sharma.

Sharma said the park will have capacity to attract projects worth nearly Rs 4,000 crore and it will generate large number of employment in the region, engaging vendors, contractors and other service providers.

In the new solar policy that aims to achieve a target of 30,000 MW solar power projects, RRECL has laid emphasis on setting up Ultra Mega Renewable Energy Power Parks in joint venture. RRECL is currently in discussion with three other Central public sector enterprises (CPSUs) to develop joint venture projects in the state.

Sharma said RRECL has already had preliminary discussions with Power Finance Corporation, Solar Energy Corporation of India, and National Hydroelectric Power Corporation for developing solar parks. “We will continue to have discussions with the CPSUs for developing new solar parks as they will play an important part in achieving the 30,000 megawatt target by 2024-25 as outlined in the policy,” added Sharma.

In fact, on December 19 last year when the solar policy was announced, Reliance Industries proposed to put up 200 MW capacity solar plant. Recently, Eden Renewables and Adani group have proposed to invest Rs 2,072 crore in the renewable power sector and both the projects have been given 100% exemption from stamp duty and conversion charges under the new RIPS.

As per the proposals, Eden Renewables will set up 300 MW solar energy project with an investment of Rs 1,572 crore in the 3716 bigha land. Similarly, Adani Group has proposed a 50 MW project for wind energy having investment of Rs 500 crore.

Title: 62 pvt buses impounded in surprise raids by spl teams
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Vijayawada: The Krishna district transport department cracked the whip on private travel operators on Wednesday. They conducted surprise checks in the early hours of Tuesday across the district and impounded 62 private buses for violation of norms.

Four special teams, set up by deputy transport commissioner (DTC), S Venkateswara Rao checked private buses. The teams were deployed at Pottipadu toll plaza, Kanaka Durga Varadhi, Karikapadu check post and Keesara toll plaza.

The buses were impounded for overpricing, permit violations, tax evasion and lack of passenger list. While eight buses were seized at Kanaka Durga Varadhi, 26 buses were impounded at Keesara toll plaza, seven cases were booked at Garikapadu check post and 21 buses were seized at Pottipadu.

Speaking to reporters, Venkateswara Rao said they had received complaints about overpricing of tickets in private buses. He said private travels should adhere to the permit norms in ticket charges.

“Some of the travel operators are violating the norms to cash in the increased demand during festivals. We will continue the surprise checks and take stringent action if any violations are found” he said.

Title: Apartment prices in Mumbai down only 2% since 2018
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: Office space was the only bright spot in an otherwise stagnant real estate market, which recorded a measly 1% increase in apartment sales across India last year, said a report released on Tuesday.Office space consumption shot up to 60.6 million sq ft (lease) in 2019 in India, a healthy increase of 27% from 47.6 million sq ft in 2018. The Mumbai region saw its best office space absorption of 9.7 million sq ft in 2019 compared to 7.9 million sq ft the year before, but was overtaken by Hyderabad, said the India Real Estate report released by Knight Frank India.The office space market received a boost due to demand from a few sectors like information technology (IT) and banking, financial services and insurance (BFSI), said Knight Frank executive director Gulam Zia.While apartment sales remained stagnant in India, Mumbai region took a much bigger hit, with sales plummeting by 14% in the second half of 2019 compared to the same period in 2018. In 2018, 2.42 lakh units were sold in the country, and it increased by just over 3,500 units (2.45 lakh), said the report. “The Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) has been hugely negative, along with Pune, among the top eight cities”, said Zia. “In 2018, we had 31,481 units selling in MMR, but only 27,212 sold last year.” The prices of apartments in MMR continued to correct, but marginally. The weighted average prices were down 2% since 2018, and by 14% from the peak of 2016.Expectedly, office space consumption was the highest at 15.3 million sq ft in 2019 in Bengaluru, compared to 13.4 million in the previous year. But it was Hyderabad that saw the highest jump of 82% (12.8 million last year compared to 7 million in 2018).In the domestic segment, developers continued to launch compact homes to get the ticket size right. Over five years between 2014 and 2019, the average size of apartments has shrunk by 25%, said the report.Affordable houses continued to dominate launches in MMR with 61% of new offers in the second half of 2019 coming under Rs 75 lakh. “The Thane market recorded the highest growth of new launches — up 36% year-on-year,” said the report.Apart from reduction in base prices, several freebies such as no floor rise, two-year free maintenance, free clubhouse membership, GST waivers, assured two-year rental schemes continue to remain in the market. As the market has been subdued for a few years now, some developers are continuing to offer deferred payment plans even for OC-ready projects.

Title: Mumbai: 2,700 railway mishap fatalities in 2019, lowest in 5 years
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: Mumbai railways in 2019 witnessed the least accidental deaths in the past five years. Nearly 2,700 commuters were killed last year, which is 19% lower than fatalities recorded in 2015. But the fact that the figure is in thousands means that efforts to minimise deaths have to continue on a war-footing, experts said.

Men formed 89% of the casualties in 2019, while track-crossing was the biggest killer. Over 1,400 commuters were killed crossing tracks , a penal offence, but efforts, such as building boundary walls and using concertina wire, seem to have worked as track-crossing deaths dropped by 10%, compared to 2018. Over 600 died after falling off locals last year. Railways said this will reduce as more closed-door AC locals are operated.

“Western Railway has four AC rakes, and three are in the offing. Seven swap rakes, which can run as AC and non-AC, are in the pipeline too,” said Ravindra Bhakar, chief public relations officer, WR.

Central Railway received its first AC local last month and six are in the pipeline this year.

Kalyan GRP post, which covers Kalyan-Kasara and Kalyan-Badlapur belts, recorded 331 deaths, which is the highest.

On WR, Borivli post, which covers Dahisar-Ram Mandir belt, had most casualties (241). “The population in the extended suburbs of Kalyan, Badlapur and Ambernath has expanded rapidly, but there is no alternative means of affordable and efficient transport developed for them to reach Mumbai, except railways,” said activist Subhash Gupta, a National Railway Users’ Consultative Council member.

Trespassing deaths have reduced as more foot over-bridges are being constructed. “Some have been shut for long, as they are dilapidated, but no alternative has come up nearby. This must be looked into by railways,” added Gupta. Reducing gaps between platforms and rakes helped reduce fatalities too, experts said.

The impact of railway mishaps is so great that it can be impossible to identify an individual killed. At least 24% commuters killed last year could not be identified. “We have a Shodh website, where photos of unknown victims are posted,” said a police officer.

Read this story in Marathi.

Title: Cradle babies have grown up, some pursuing higher education
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

The cradle baby scheme was implemented in the state in 1999 in Salem to prevent female infanticide and later e... Read More

MADURAI: In a press release, Dindigul district collector M Vijayalakshmi has said that cradle baby scheme was implemented in the state in 1999 in Salem to prevent female infanticide and later extended to other districts including Madurai, Dindigul and Theni in 2001.

There was a time when parents thought of their female children as a burden and used to abandon them or resorted to killing them. It was then that former chief minister J Jayalalithaa launched the cradle baby scheme through the department of social welfare to protect the children.

All these children are admitted to government homes. Many of them are adopted, but a handful of them remain there. These remaining few are pursuing their higher education and schooling. In 2001, four female infants were brought under this scheme, and one of them is pursuing her medical education, while another is doing her post-graduation and two others industrial training courses.

The district received seven male infants under the scheme from 2002 to 2003 who are studying in school. Similarly, 21 children, including 16 girls were received during 2004-2005, and all of them are studying in school.

Last year, the district received three cradle babies who were abandoned in different parts of the district, which includes a female infant. The government provides a sum of Rs 2,000 per month for the education and other needs of the children in the homes.

Title: Meerut: 3 held for animal skin smuggling, leopard pelt seized
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

A leopard pelt worth Rs 20 lakh in the international market was seized from them

MEERUT: Three suspects involved in animal skin smuggling were arrested by a team of Deoband police in UP’s Saharanpur district . A leopard pelt worth Rs 20 lakh in the international market was seized from them.

"The trio has been arrested. A leopard pelt purchased in Dehradun and a motorcycle were recovered from them. An FIR under relevant sections the of Wildlife (Protection) Act was also registered against them and investigation is on,” said Saharanpur police officer.

During interrogation, the arrested suspects -- Rakesh Dhiman, Amit and Abhay Tandon -- all residents of Saharanpur. claimed that they had purchased the pelt from one Ashutosh Pandit in Dehradun. Pandit earlier used to live in Deoband. According to the accused, they used to purchase animal skins from Pandit at cheap rates and sell it at a high price. ssss

Several districts of western UP are infamous as hubs of animal smuggling syndicates. In April 2017, Rs 1 crore in cash, arms and ammunition as well as animal skins, parts and meat, were seized from the Meerut house of a retired colonel. The seizures pointed to poaching and arms smuggling. The racket was being run from the house of the retired Army officer, who is a 1971 war and Operation Blue Star veteran, and his national-level shooter son.

Title: Official apathy leaves BSNL customers sans 4G access
Content:
This story is from January 8, 2020

MANGALURU: The Dakshina Kannada BSNL network for Mangaluru city is 4G ready, but officials are not. All it requires is 15 minutes to switch over from 3G to 4G, but officials have been reluctant to flip the switch.

BSNL officials here have been pushing deadlines for 4G services in a manner that customers are facing a situation similar to the Pumpwell flyover issue, with deadlines being extended four times for 4G rollout by BSNL. The last deadline to be missed was on January 5. Interestingly, the service is already up and running in 13 towers from Ucchila in Udupi district to Mukka near Surathkal, about 24 km from here.

Sources said that 151 towers in the Mangaluru area have were converted to 4G technology a fortnight ago, but officials at the helm of affairs are reluctant to switch on the services for some inexplicable reason.

BSNL has already reformed the 2,100MHz spectrum band, used for 3G, to strengthen its 4G network. The telecom operator is deploying L900 technology in the 2,100MHz band to complement its 4G services. When activated, 4G services would be seamlessly available from Uchila till Nethravathi Bridge in Mangaluru, for a distance of about 50 km and till Farangipete on the Mangaluru-Bengaluru National Highway. Beyond 4G connectivity, the services would automatically switch over to 3G services when the customers move out of the 4G range. Rollout of the service in the district is expected by April 2020.

BSNL Dakshina Kannada general manager G R Ravi admitted the 4G network was in place, and that they were waiting for all subscribers to change their 3G sim cards to 4G sims. When asked, isn’t it a tall order considering that BSNL has been repeatedly announcing customers to get their sims changed since August last year, Ravi said they will take a decision on the rollout soon as permission from the main office was received. “We will decide on a date soon and inform our subscribers,’’ he said.

But officials involved with 4G conversion are fuming since the network is ready, and what needs to be is just a switch over, which hardly takes 15 minutes. “When a telecom major changed from 3G to 4G a few years back, it did not even have 20% of the subscriber base change their sims to 4G. What are we waiting for? These kind of ham-handed decisions are hurting BSNL’s prospects,’’ said the source, who is closely working on the technology conversion. Once 4G services are available, customers who do not get 3G services will automatically change their sim cards, said an official, adding that sim cards were given for free in case the customer presented the old 3G sim, which would otherwise cost Rs 50. As on January 5, the 3G sim conversion to 4G was at 35% in Mangaluru and 37% in the areas from Uchila to Mukka.
